column1: line_number,speaker,text,label,file_name
1,RADDATZ,Good evening to you all.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
2,RADDATZ,The rules for tonight are very basic and have been agreed to by all three campaigns in advance.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
3,RADDATZ,Candidates can take up to a minute-and-a-half to respond directly to a question.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
4,RADDATZ,"For a rebuttal, for a follow-up, 45 seconds will be allowed.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
5,RADDATZ,"There are green, yellow, and red lights that each candidate will see to signal when time is running out and when they're supposed to be finished with their answers.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
6,MUIR,"We will be tackling many critical issues right here tonight, and we begin with opening statements, in alphabetical order, and Secretary Clinton.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
7,CLINTON,"Well, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
8,CLINTON,And I'm delighted to be here in New Hampshire for this debate.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
9,CLINTON,"You know, the American president has to both keep our families safe and make the economy grow in a way that helps everyone, not just those at the top.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
10,CLINTON,That's the job.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

11,CLINTON,"I have a strategy to combat and defeat ISIS without getting us involved in another ground war, and I have plans to raise incomes and deal with a lot of the problems that keep families up at night.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
12,CLINTON,I'm very clear that we have a distinct difference between those of us on this stage tonight and all of our Republican counterparts.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
13,CLINTON,"From my perspective, we have to prevent the Republicans from rolling back the progress that we've made.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
14,CLINTON,"They would repeal the Affordable Care Act, not improve it.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
15,CLINTON,"They would give more tax breaks to the super-wealthy and corporations, not to the middle class.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
16,CLINTON,"And they would, despite all their tough talk about terrorism, continue to let people who are on the no-fly list buy guns.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

17,CLINTON,"So we have a lot of work to do in this campaign to make it clear where we stand in the Democratic Party, what we will do for our country, and I look forward to this evening's discussion of real issues that face the American people.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
18,CLINTON,Thank you.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
19,RADDATZ,"Thank you, Secretary Clinton.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
20,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
21,RADDATZ,Governor O'Malley?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
22,O'MALLEY,"Martha, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

23,O'MALLEY,"Tonight we have a different debate than the debates that we have been allowed to have so far, because tonight is different because of this reason, that in the course of this presidential campaign America has again been attacked by jihadi terrorists, American lives taken from us.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

24,O'MALLEY,"So, yes, we must talk about our ideas to move our economy forward, but the first job of the president of the United States is to protect the people of the United States.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
25,O'MALLEY,I visited with a number of our neighbors in Northern Virginia at a mosque last Friday.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
26,O'MALLEY,"And as I looked out there at the eyes of our neighbors, I also looked in the eyes of veterans.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
27,O'MALLEY,I looked into the eyes of Boy Scouts.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
28,O'MALLEY,I looked into the eyes of moms and dads who would do anything in their power to protect our country's values and our freedoms.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
29,O'MALLEY,"What our nation needs right now is to realize that, while we face a terrible danger, we also face a different sort of political danger.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
30,O'MALLEY,And that is the danger that democracies find themselves susceptible to when unscrupulous leaders try to turn us upon each other.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
31,O'MALLEY,What our country needs right now is new leadership that will bring us together around the values that unite us and the freedoms that we share as Americans.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
32,O'MALLEY,We will rise to challenge of ISIL and we will rise together to the challenges that we face in our economy.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

33,O'MALLEY,"But we will only do so if we hold true to the values and the freedoms that unite us, which means we must never surrender them to terrorists, must never surrender our Americans values to racist, must never surrender to the fascist pleas of billionaires with big mouths.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
34,O'MALLEY,We are a better country than this.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
35,O'MALLEY,"Our enduring symbol is not the barbed wire fence, it is the Statue of Liberty.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
36,O'MALLEY,And America's best days are in front of us if we move forward together.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
37,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
38,MUIR,Senator Sanders.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
39,SANDERS,Good evening.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
40,SANDERS,I am running for president of the United States because it is too late for establishment politics and establishment economics.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

41,SANDERS,I'm running for president because our economy is rigged because working people are working longer hours for lower wages and almost all of new wealth and income being created is going to the top one percent.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
42,SANDERS,I'm running for president because I'm going to create an economy that works for working families not just billionaires.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

43,SANDERS,"I'm running for president because we have a campaign finance system which is corrupt, where billionaires are spending hundreds of millionaires of dollars to buy candidates who will represent their interests rather than the middle class and working families.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

44,SANDERS,I'm running because we need to address the planetary crisis of climate change and take on the fossil fuel industry and transform our energy system away from fossil fuel to energy efficiency and sustainable energy.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

45,SANDERS,"I'm running for president because I want a new foreign policy; one that takes on Isis, one that destroys ISIS, but one that does not get us involved in perpetual warfare in the quagmire of the Middle East but rather works around a major coalition of wealthy and powerful nations supporting Muslim troops on the ground.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
46,SANDERS,That's the kind of coalition we need and that's the kind of coalition I will put together.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
47,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
48,MUIR,Senator Sanders thank you and thank you all.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

49,MUIR,We do have a lot of important issues to get here tonight and we want to address the controversy of the last 24 hours right off the top because we heard some of the most heated rhetoric of the campaign so far between two of the campaigns on this stage tonight.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

50,MUIR,"Senator Sanders, you fired a campaign staffer you have sued the Democratic National Committee; all of this after your campaign acknowledge that some of your staffers quote, ""irresponsibly accessed data from another campaign.""",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
51,MUIR,"The Clinton campaign called this a very egregious breech of data of ethics and said, quote, ""our data was stolen.""",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
52,MUIR,Did they overstate this or were your staffers essentially stealing part of the Clinton playbook?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
53,SANDERS,"David, let me give you a little bit of background here.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
54,SANDERS,The DNC has hired vendors.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
55,SANDERS,"On two occasions, there were breeches in information two months ago.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
56,SANDERS,Our staff found information on our computers from the Clinton campaign.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
57,SANDERS,"And when our staffers said, ""whoa, what's going here?""",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
58,SANDERS,They went to the DNC quietly.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
59,SANDERS,"They went to the vendor and said, ""hey, something is wrong,"" and that was quietly dealt with.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
60,SANDERS,None of that information was looked at.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
61,SANDERS,Our staffer at that point did exactly the right thing.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
62,SANDERS,A few days ago a similar incident happened.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
63,SANDERS,"There was a breach because the DNC vendor screwed up, information came to our campaign.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
64,SANDERS,"In this case, our staff did the wrong thing -- they looked a that information.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
65,SANDERS,As soon as we learned that they looked at that information - we fired that person.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
66,SANDERS,We are now doing an independent internal investigation to see who else was involved.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
67,SANDERS,"Thirdly, what I have a really problem, and as you mentioned - this is a problem, I recognize it as a problem.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
68,SANDERS,But what the DNC did arbitrarily without discussing it with us is shut off our access to our information crippling our campaign.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
69,SANDERS,That is an egregious act.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
70,SANDERS,"I'm glad that late last night, that was resolved.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

71,SANDERS,"Fourthly, I work -- look forward to working with Secretary Clinton for an investigation, an independent investigation, about all of the breaches that have occurred from day one in this campaign, because I am not convinced that information from our campaign may not have ended up in her campaign.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
72,SANDERS,Don't know that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
73,SANDERS,"But we need an independent investigation, and I hope Secretary Clinton will agree with me for the need of that.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
74,SANDERS,Last point.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
75,SANDERS,"When we saw the breach two months, we didn't go running to the media and make a big deal about it.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
76,SANDERS,"And it bothers me very much that, rather than working on this issue to resolve it, it has become many press releases from the Clinton campaign later.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
77,MUIR,"But Senator, you do mention the DNC -- the vender.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
78,MUIR,But you said of your staff that they did the wrong thing.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
79,SANDERS,Absolutely.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
80,SANDERS,Bernie Sanders apologizes to Hillary Clinton,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
81,SANDERS,"At ABC's Democratic presidential debate, candidate Bernie Sanders apologizes to rival Hillary Clinton for a scandal involving key voter data.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
82,MUIR,"So, does Secretary Clinton deserve an apology tonight?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
83,SANDERS,"Yes, I apologize.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
84,MUIR,Secretary Clinton...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
85,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

86,SANDERS,Not only -- not only do I apologize to Secretary Clinton -- and I hope we can work together on an independent investigation from day one -- I want to apologize to my supporters.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
87,SANDERS,This is not the type of campaign that we run.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
88,SANDERS,"And if I find anybody else involved in this, they will also be fired.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
89,MUIR,"Secretary Clinton, he has apologized.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
90,MUIR,How do your react?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
91,CLINTON,"I very much appreciate that comment, Bernie.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
92,CLINTON,It really is important that we go forward on this.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
93,CLINTON,"I know that you now have your data back, and that there has been an agreement for an independent inquiry into what did happen.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

94,CLINTON,"Obviously, we were distressed when we learned of it, because we have worked very hard -- I said in the beginning of this campaign, we want to reach as many voters as possible, and we have tens of thousands of volunteers doing that, and entering data all the time to keep up with what people are telling us.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
95,CLINTON,"And so, now that, I think, you know, we have resolved your data, we have agreed on an independent inquiry, we should move on.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
96,CLINTON,Because I don't think the American people are all that interested in this.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
97,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
98,CLINTON,I think they're more interested in what we have to say about all the big issues facing us.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
99,O'MALLEY,"Yeah, David, look, for crying out loud, our country has been attacked, we have pressing issues involving how we're going to adapt to this changing era of warfare.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
100,O'MALLEY,Our economy -- people are working harder and being left behind.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
101,O'MALLEY,You want to know why things don't get done in Washington?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

102,O'MALLEY,"Because for the last 24 hours, with those issues being so urgent to people as they tune in tonight, wondering how they're even be able to buy presents for their kids.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
103,O'MALLEY,"Instead, we're listening to the bickering back and forth.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
104,O'MALLEY,"Maybe that is normal politics in Washington, but that is not the politics of higher purpose that people expect from our party.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
105,O'MALLEY,"We need to address our security issues, we need to address the economic issues around the kitchen table.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
106,O'MALLEY,"And if people want a more high-minded politics and want to move our country forward, go on to martinomalley.com and help my campaign move our country forward.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
107,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
108,MUIR,All three candidates are weighing in.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
109,SANDERS,Let me agree with Governor O'Malley and let me agree with Secretary Clinton.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
110,SANDERS,"You know, we had this incident before, Secretary, with your famous e-mails.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
111,SANDERS,Right?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

112,SANDERS,"And what I said and I think what Governor O'Malley is saying, and I hope you say, is when the middle class of this country is disappearing, when we have massive income and wealth inequality, when we're the only major country on earth not guaranteeing health care to all people, all the issues that the governor talked about, the secretary talked about, those are the issues.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
113,SANDERS,Media notwithstanding.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
114,SANDERS,Those are the issues that the American people want discussed.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
115,SANDERS,I hope those are the issues we'll discuss.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
116,MUIR,"Good let's move on -- Senator Sanders, let's move on right to some of those issues.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
117,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
118,MUIR,"It is just six days before Christmas, as we all know in this country.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
119,MUIR,"It's typically a joyful time, as it is this year, as well.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
120,MUIR,But it's also an anxious time.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
121,MUIR,President Obama has acknowledged that what we saw in San Bernardino was an act of terrorism.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
122,MUIR,"But we remember the president said, right before Thanksgiving, there is no known specific and credible intelligence indicating a plot on the homeland.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
123,MUIR,We now know that this couple had assembled an arsenal.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
124,MUIR,They were not on law enforcement's radar.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
125,MUIR,They were completely undetected.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

126,MUIR,"So as we approach another holiday, with the president again saying, late this week, no credible threat, Secretary Clinton, how confident should the American people be, that there aren't others like that couple right now in the U.S. going undetected?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
127,MUIR,And what would you do as president to find them?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
128,CLINTON,"Well, first, the most important job of being president is obviously to keep our country safe and to keep the families of America safe.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
129,CLINTON,I have a plan that I've put forward to go after ISIS.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
130,CLINTON,"Not to contain them, but to defeat them.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
131,CLINTON,And it has three parts.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
132,CLINTON,"First, to go after them and deprive them of the territory they occupy now in both Syria and Iraq.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
133,CLINTON,"Secondly, to go after and dismantle their global network of terrorism.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
134,CLINTON,"And thirdly, to do more to keep us safe.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
135,CLINTON,"Under each of those three parts of my plan, I have very specific recommendations about what to do.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
136,CLINTON,"Obviously, in the first, we do have to have a -- an American-led air campaign, we have to have Arab and Kurdish troops on the ground.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
137,CLINTON,"Secondly, we've got to go after everything from North Africa to South Asia and beyond.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
138,CLINTON,"And then, most importantly, here at home, I think there are three things that we have to get right.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
139,CLINTON,We have to do the best possible job of sharing intelligence and information.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
140,CLINTON,"That now includes the internet, because we have seen that ISIS is a very effective recruiter, propagandist and inciter and celebrator of violence.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
141,CLINTON,That means we have to work more closely with our great tech companies.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
142,CLINTON,"They can't see the government as an adversary, we can't see them as obstructionists.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
143,CLINTON,We've got to figure out how we can do more to understand who is saying what and what they're planning.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
144,CLINTON,And we must work more closely with Muslim-American communities.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
145,CLINTON,"Just like Martin, I met with a group of Muslim-Americans this past week to hear from them about what they're doing to try to stop radicalization.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
146,CLINTON,They will be our early warning signal.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
147,CLINTON,"That's why we need to work with them, not demonize them, as the Republicans have been doing.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
148,O'MALLEY,"David, I am the very first...",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
149,MUIR,(inaudible) thank you.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
150,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
151,MUIR,I am the very first post-9/11 mayor and the very first post-9/11 governor.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

152,MUIR,"I understand, from the ground up, that when attacks like San Bernardino happen, when attacks like the attacks of 9/11 happen, that when people call 911, the first people to show up are the local first responders.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

153,MUIR,"Many of the things Secretary Clinton said are absolutely true, but they underscore a lack of investment that we have, as a nation, failed to make over these last 15 years in intelligence gathering, intelligence analysis, intelligence sharing.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

154,MUIR,"Not only in theater, in Syria and Iraq and other places where we embalk (ph) ourselves in toppling dictators without having any idea what comes next, but here in the homeland, as we protect people from this threat of the lone wolves and these changing tactics and strategies.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
155,MUIR,"I believe that what's happened here is that the president had us on the right course, but it's a lack of battle tempo.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

156,MUIR,"We have to increase the battle tempo, we have to bring a modern way of getting things done and forcing the sharing of information and do a much better job of acting on it in order to prevent these sorts of attacks in the future.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
157,MUIR,"And we're going to break down these issues tonight, but I do want to go to Senator Sanders because the concern going into Christmas is significant, as you know.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
158,MUIR,A new ABC News poll shows 77 percent of Americans have little or no confidence in the government's ability to prevent a lone wolf attack.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
159,MUIR,How would you specifically find would-be terrorist who are going undetected?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
160,SANDERS,I'm one of the 77 percent.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
161,SANDERS,I think this is a very difficult issue.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
162,SANDERS,Let me agree with much of what the secretary and the governor have said.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
163,SANDERS,Let me tell you what I think we have got to do.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
164,SANDERS,I think it's a two-pronged issue.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
165,SANDERS,"Number one, our goal is to crush and destroy ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
166,SANDERS,What is the best way to do it?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
167,SANDERS,"Well, I think there are some differences of opinion here, perhaps between the secretary and myself.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

168,SANDERS,I voted against the war in Iraq because I thought unilateral military action would not produce the results that were necessary and would lead to the kind of unraveling and instability that we saw in the Middle East.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
169,SANDERS,I do not believe in unilateral American action.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
170,SANDERS,"I believe in action in which we put together a strong coalition of forces, major powers and the Muslim nations.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

171,SANDERS,"I think one of the heroes in a real quagmire out there, in a dangerous and difficult world, one of the heroes who we should recognize in the Middle East is King Abdullah II of Jordan.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
172,SANDERS,This small country has welcomed in many refugees.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
173,SANDERS,"And Abdullah said something recently, very important.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

174,SANDERS,"He said, ""Yes, international terrorism is by definition an international issue, but it is primarily an issue of the Muslim nations who are fighting for the soul of Islam. We the Muslims should lead the effort on the ground.""",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
175,SANDERS,And I believe he is absolutely right.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
176,MUIR,"Senator, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
177,RADDATZ,"Secretary Clinton, in the wake of the San Bernardino attack, you all emphasized gun control.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
178,RADDATZ,"But our latest poll shows that more Americans believe arming people, not stricter gun laws, is the best defense against terrorism.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
179,RADDATZ,Are they wrong?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

180,CLINTON,"Well, I think you have to look at both the terrorism challenge that we face abroad and certainly at home and the role that guns play in delivering the violence that stalks us.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
181,CLINTON,"Clearly, we have to have a very specific set of actions to take.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
182,CLINTON,"You know, when Senator Sanders talks about a coalition, I agree with him about that.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
183,CLINTON,We've got to build a coalition abroad.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
184,CLINTON,We also have to build a coalition at home.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
185,CLINTON,"Abroad, we need a coalition that is going to take on ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
186,CLINTON,I know how hard that is.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
187,CLINTON,I know it isn't something you just hope people will do and I've worked on that...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
188,RADDATZ,"Secretary Clinton, can we stick to gun control?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
189,CLINTON,"Yes, I'm getting...",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
190,RADDATZ,Are they wrong?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
191,CLINTON,I'm getting to that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
192,CLINTON,"Because I think if you only think about the coalition abroad you're missing the main point, which is we need a coalition here at home.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
193,CLINTON,"Guns, in and of themselves, in my opinion, will not make Americans safer.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
194,CLINTON,"We lose 33,000 people a year already to gun violence, arming more people to do what I think is not the appropriate response to terrorism.",1,20151219_3_dem.tsv
195,CLINTON,I think what is...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
196,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
197,CLINTON,"Is creating much deeper, closer relations and, yes, coalitions within our own country.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
198,CLINTON,The first line of defense against radicalization is in Muslim-American community.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
199,CLINTON,People who we should be welcoming and working with.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

200,CLINTON,"I worry greatly that the rhetoric coming from the Republicans, particularly Donald Trump, is sending a message to Muslims here in the United States and literally around the world that there is a ""clash of civilizations,"" that there is some kind of Western plot or even ""war against Islam,"" which then I believe fans the flames of radicalization.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
201,CLINTON,"So guns have to be looked at as its own problem, but we also have to figure out how we're going to deal with the radicalization here in the United States.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
202,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
203,RADDATZ,"Senator Sanders -- wait just a moment, please, Governor O'Malley.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
204,RADDATZ,"Senator Sanders, we've seen those long lines of people buying guns in record numbers after the Paris attacks.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
205,RADDATZ,Would you discourage people from buying a gun?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
206,SANDERS,It's a country in which people choose to buy guns.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
207,SANDERS,"I think half of the -- more than half of the people in my own state of Vermont, my guess here in New Hampshire, are gun owners.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

420,CLINTON,I would prioritize them.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
421,CLINTON,And that would I think give the American public a bit more of a sense of security about who is being processed and who might end up coming as refugees.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
422,MUIR,"Governor O'Malley, obviously you were governor yourself at one time.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
423,MUIR,What would you say to New Hampshire's governor tonight?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
424,MUIR,Is she wrong on this?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
425,O'MALLEY,"No, what I would say is this is look, I was the first of the three of us to call for America to accept the 65,000 refugees we were asked to accept.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
426,O'MALLEY,"And if this humanitarian crisis increases, we should accept more.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
427,MUIR,So the idea of a halt or a pause?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
428,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
429,O'MALLEY,"David, there are wider vulnerabilities than when it comes to refugees.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
430,O'MALLEY,"I met recently with some members of the Chaldean Christian communities and the wait times are a year, 18 months, 24 months.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
431,O'MALLEY,There is a pretty excruciating process that refugees go through.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
432,O'MALLEY,We need to invest more in terms of the other sort of visas and the other sort of waivers.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

433,O'MALLEY,"What these Chaldean families told me was that their families in Syria, when ISIS moves into their town, they actually paint a red cross across the door and mark their homes for demolition, and that tells the family you'd better get out now.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
434,O'MALLEY,"The sort of genocide and brutality that the victims are suffering, these are not the perpetrators.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
435,O'MALLEY,"We need to be the nation whose enduring symbol is the Statue of Liberty, and we need to act like the great country we are, according to our values.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

452,RADDATZ,Thank you.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
453,RADDATZ,I do want to move to the fight against ISIS.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
454,SANDERS,Yeah.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
455,RADDATZ,"For the people of New Hampshire, the brutality of ISIS is personal.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

457,RADDATZ,"The first hostage, a journalist, brutally executed last year.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
458,RADDATZ,You've all said ISIS is a ruthless enemy and must be stopped.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
459,RADDATZ,Al Qaida as well.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
460,RADDATZ,"Senator Sanders, you voted to send U.S. ground forces to fight in the coalition to help destroy Al Qaida in Afghanistan.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
461,RADDATZ,Can you then explain you why don't support sending U.S. combat troops to join a coalition to fight ISIS?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

462,SANDERS,"And I also voted and helped lead the effort against the war in Iraq, which will go down in history as one of the worst foreign blunders -- foreign policy blunders in the history of our country.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
463,SANDERS,"I voted against the first Gulf War, which set the stage, I believe, for the second Iraq war.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

464,SANDERS,"And what I believe right now, and I believe this is terribly important, is the United States of America cannot succeed, or be thought of as the policeman of the world, that when there's an international crisis all over the world, in France and in the U.K. Or -- hey, just call up the American military and the American taxpayers, they're going to send the troops.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
465,SANDERS,And if they have to be in the Middle East for 20 or 30 years no problem.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
466,RADDATZ,"But why Al Qaida, why not ISIS?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
467,SANDERS,"I have a problem with that, Martha.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
468,SANDERS,"What I believe has got to happen is there must be an international coalition, including Russia, a well-coordinated effort.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
469,SANDERS,"But I agree, as I mentioned a moment ago, with King Abdullah.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
470,SANDERS,This is a war for the soul of Islam.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
471,SANDERS,The troops on the ground should not be American troops.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
472,SANDERS,They should be Muslim troops.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

473,SANDERS,"I believe that countries like Saudi Arabia and Qatar have got to step up to the plate, have got to contribute the money that we need, and the troops that we need, to destroy ISIS with American support.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
474,RADDATZ,The administration has tried that over and over again.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
475,RADDATZ,"If it doesn't work and this threat is so great, what's your plan B?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

476,SANDERS,"My plan is to make it work, to tell Saudi Arabia that instead of going to war in Yemen, they, one of the wealthiest countries on Earth, are going to have to go to war against ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
477,SANDERS,"To tell Qatar, that instead of spending $200 billion on the World Cup, maybe they should pay attention to ISIS, which is at their doorstep.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

479,RADDATZ,"Secretary Clinton, you too have ruled out a large U.S. combat force, yet you support sending in special operations forces to Syria, and sending those 100 to 200 troops to Iraq to do exploitation kill raids.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
480,RADDATZ,We've already lost one Delta Force member in a raid.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
481,RADDATZ,It has looked very much to me like we're already in ground combat on frequent trips I've made there.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
482,RADDATZ,"So, are you fooling Americans when you say, we're not putting American combat troops back into Syria or Iraq?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
483,CLINTON,No.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
484,CLINTON,Not at all.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
485,CLINTON,I think that what we're facing with ISIS is especially complicated.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
486,CLINTON,It was a different situation in Afghanistan.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
487,CLINTON,We were attacked from Afghanistan.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
488,CLINTON,Al Qaida was based in Afghanistan.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
489,CLINTON,We went after those who had attacked us.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

490,CLINTON,"What's happening in Syria and Iraq is that, because of the failures in the region, including the failure of the prior government in Baghdad, led by Maliki, there has been a resurgence of Sunni activities, as exemplified by ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

491,CLINTON,"And we have to support Sunni-Arab and Kurdish forces against ISIS, because I believe it would be not only a strategic mistake for the United States to put ground combat troops in, as opposed to special operators, as opposed to trainers, because that is exactly what ISIS wants.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
492,CLINTON,They've advertised that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
493,CLINTON,They want American troops back in the Middle East.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
494,CLINTON,"They want American soldiers on the ground fighting them, giving them many more targets, and giving them a great recruiting opportunity.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

495,CLINTON,"So, I think it's absolutely wrong policy for us to be even imagining we're going end up putting tens of thousands of American troops into Syria and Iraq to fight ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
496,CLINTON,And we do have to form a coalition.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
497,CLINTON,I know how hard that is.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
498,CLINTON,I have formed them.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
499,CLINTON,"I put together a coalition, including Arabs, with respect to Libya and a coalition to put sanctions onto Iran.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
500,CLINTON,And you have to really work hard at it.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

501,CLINTON,"And the final thing I would say, bringing Donald Trump back into it, if you're going to put together a coalition in the region to take on the threat of ISIS you don't want to alienate the very countries and people you need to be part of the coalition.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
502,CLINTON,And so that is part of the reason why this is so difficult.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
503,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
504,RADDATZ,"Secretary Clinton, I want -- I want to follow up on that.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
505,RADDATZ,You do support sending special operations forces there.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
506,RADDATZ,You support what the president has done already.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
507,RADDATZ,One of the lessons people draw from Vietnam and war since is that a little force can turn into a little more and a little more.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
508,RADDATZ,"President Obama certainly didn't expect to be sending 30,000 additional troops into Afghanistan the first year of his presidency.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
509,RADDATZ,"Are you prepared to run the risk of a bigger war to achieve your goals to destroy ISIS, or are you prepared to give up on those goals if it requires a larger force?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
510,CLINTON,"Well, I just think you're asking a question with a false choice.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

511,CLINTON,"I believe if we lead an air coalition, which we are now in the position of doing and intensify it, if we continue to build back up the Iraqi army, which has had some recent success in Ramadi, as you know, if we get back talking to the tribal sheiks in Anbar to try to rebuild those relationships, which were very successful, in going after Al Qaida in Iraq, if we get the Turks to pay more attention to ISIS than they're paying to the Kurds, if we do put together the kind of coalition with the specific tasks that I am outlining, I think we can be successful in destroying ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
512,CLINTON,"So that's what I'm focused on, that's what I've outlined and that's what I would do as president.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
513,RADDATZ,Governor O'Malley.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
514,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
515,RADDATZ,You've emphasized the need for more human intelligence on the ground.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
516,RADDATZ,What is it our intelligence community is not doing now that needs to be done?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
517,O'MALLEY,"Well, we have invested nowhere near what we should be investing in human intelligence on the ground.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
518,O'MALLEY,"And what I'm talking about is not only the covert CIA intelligence, I'm also talking about diplomatic intelligence.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

519,O'MALLEY,"I mean, we've seen time and time again, especially in this very troubled region of nation-state failures, and then we have no idea who the next generation of leaders are that are coming forward.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

520,O'MALLEY,"So what I would say is not only do we need to be thinking in military terms, but we do our military a disservice when we don't greatly dial up the investment that we are making in diplomacy and human intelligence and when we fail to dial up properly, the role of sustainable development in all of this.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
521,O'MALLEY,"As president, I would make the administrator of USAID an actual cabinet member.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
522,O'MALLEY,"We have to act in a much more whole of government approach, as General Dempsey said.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
523,O'MALLEY,"And I do believe, and I would disagree somewhat with one of my colleagues, this is a genocidal threat.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

524,O'MALLEY,"They have now created a safe haven in the vacuum that we allowed to be partly and because of our blunders, to be created to be created in the areas of Syria and Iraq.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

525,O'MALLEY,"We cannot allow safe havens, and as a leader of moral nations around this Earth, we need to come up with new alliances and new ways to prepare for these new sorts of threats, because Martha, this will not be the last region where nation-states fail.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
526,O'MALLEY,And you've seen a little bit of this emerging in the -- in the African Union and the things that they have done to better stabilize Somalia.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
527,O'MALLEY,We need to pay attention here in Central America as well.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
528,O'MALLEY,So this is the new type of threats that we're facing and we need to lead as a nation in confronting it and putting together new alliances and new coalitions.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
529,CLINTON,"Well, I just want to quickly add...",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
530,RADDATZ,Thank you.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

531,CLINTON,"Martha, that -- you know, one of the reasons why I have advocated for a no-fly zone is in order to create those safe refuges within Syria, to try to protect people on the ground both from Assad's forces, who are continuing to drop barrel bombs, and from ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
532,CLINTON,"And of course, it has to be de-conflicted with the Russians, who are also flying in that space.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

533,CLINTON,"I'm hoping that because of the very recent announcement of the agreement at the Security Council, which embodies actually an agreement that I negotiated back in Geneva in June of 2012, we're going to get a diplomatic effort in Syria to begin to try to make a transition.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
534,CLINTON,A no-fly zone would prevent the outflow of refugees and give us a chance to have some safe spaces.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
535,RADDATZ,"Secretary Clinton, I'd like to go back to that if I could.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
536,RADDATZ,"ISIS doesn't have aircraft, Al Qaida doesn't have aircraft.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
537,RADDATZ,So would you shoot down a Syrian military aircraft or a Russian airplane?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
538,CLINTON,I do not think it would come to that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
539,CLINTON,We are already de-conflicting air space.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
540,CLINTON,We know...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
541,RADDATZ,"But isn't that a decision you should make now, whether...",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
542,CLINTON,"No, I don't think so.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
543,CLINTON,I am advocating...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
544,RADDATZ,... if you're advocating this?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

545,CLINTON,I am advocating the no-fly zone both because I think it would help us on the ground to protect Syrians; I'm also advocating it because I think it gives us some leverage in our conversations with Russia.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

546,CLINTON,"Now that Russia has joined us in the Security Council, has adopted an agreement that we hashed out a long day in Geneva three years ago, now I think we can have those conversations.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
547,CLINTON,"The no-fly zone, I would hope, would be also shared by Russia.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

548,CLINTON,"If they will begin to turn their military attention away from going after the adversaries of Assad toward ISIS and put the Assad future on the political and diplomatic track, where it belongs.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

552,SANDERS,I have a difference of opinion with Secretary Clinton on this.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
553,SANDERS,Our differences are fairly deep on this issue.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
554,SANDERS,We disagreed on the war in Iraq.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
555,SANDERS,We both listened to the information from Bush and Cheney.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
556,SANDERS,I voted against the war.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

557,SANDERS,But I think -- and I say this with due respect -- that I worry too much that Secretary Clinton is too much into regime change and a little bit too aggressive without knowing what the unintended consequences might be.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
558,SANDERS,"Yes, we could get rid of Saddam Hussein, but that destabilized the entire region.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
559,SANDERS,"Yes, we could get rid of Gadhafi, a terrible dictator, but that created a vacuum for ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
560,SANDERS,"Yes, we could get rid of Assad tomorrow, but that would create another political vacuum that would benefit ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
561,SANDERS,"So I think, yeah, regime change is easy, getting rid of dictators is easy.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
562,SANDERS,"But before you do that, you've got to think about what happens the day after.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

563,SANDERS,"And in my view, what we need to do is put together broad coalitions to understand that we're not going to have a political vacuum filled by terrorists, that, in fact, we are going to move steadily -- and maybe slowly -- toward democratic societies, in terms of Assad, a terrible dictator.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
564,SANDERS,But I think in Syria the primary focus now must be on destroying ISIS and working over the years to get rid of Assad.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
565,SANDERS,That's the secondary issue.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
566,CLINTON,That is exactly...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
567,MUIR,"Senator, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
568,CLINTON,That is exactly what I just said and what I just described.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
569,MUIR,"Yeah, but, Secretary Clinton -- Secretary Clinton...",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
570,CLINTON,"And that is important, because now we have a U.N. Security Council that will enable us to do that.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
571,CLINTON,"And, you know, with all due respect, Senator, you voted for regime change with respect to Libya.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
572,CLINTON,"You joined the Senate in voting to get rid of Gadhafi, and you asked that there be a Security Council validation of that with a resolution.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
573,CLINTON,All of these are very difficult issues.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
574,CLINTON,I know that; I've been dealing with them for a long time.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
575,CLINTON,"And, of course, we have to continue to do what is necessary when someone like Gadhafi, a despot with American blood on his hands, is overturned.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

576,CLINTON,"But I'll tell you what would have happened, if we had not joined with our European partners and our Arab partners to assist the people in Libya, you would be looking at Syria.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
577,CLINTON,Now the Libyans are turning their attention to try to dislodge ISIS from its foothold and begin to try to move together to have a unified nation.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
578,SANDERS,I was not the secretary of state...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
579,MUIR,"Senator Sanders, Senator Sanders, hold on.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
580,MUIR,"One moment, please.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

581,MUIR,"I'm going to ask the secretary here, because there does appear to be some daylight here between the policies, at least in respect to when you take out Syrian President Bashar al-Assad.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
582,MUIR,Right now or do you wait?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
583,MUIR,Do you tackle ISIS first?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
584,MUIR,"You have said, Secretary Clinton, that you come to the conclusion that we have to proceed on both fronts at once.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

585,MUIR,"We heard from the senator just this week that we must put aside the issue of how quickly we get rid of Assad and come together with countries, including Russia and Iran, to destroy ISIS first.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
586,MUIR,Is he wrong?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
587,CLINTON,I think we're missing the point here.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
588,CLINTON,We are doing both at the same time.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
589,MUIR,"But that's what he's saying, we should put that aside for now and go after ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

590,CLINTON,"Well, I don't agree with that, because we will not get the support on the ground in Syria to dislodge ISIS if the fighters there who are not associated with ISIS, but whose principal goal is getting rid of Assad, don't believe there is a political, diplomatic channel that is ongoing.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
591,CLINTON,We now have that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
592,CLINTON,We have the U.N. Security Council adopting a resolution that lays out a transition path.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
593,CLINTON,It's very important we operate on both at the same time.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
594,CLINTON,"And let me just say a word about coalition-building, because I've heard Senator Sanders say this.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
595,CLINTON,I know how hard it is to build coalitions.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
596,CLINTON,I think it would be a grave mistake to ask for any more Iranian troops inside Syria.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
597,CLINTON,That is like asking the arsonist to come and pour more gas on the fire.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

598,CLINTON,"The Iranians getting more of a presence in Syria, linking with Hezbollah, their proxy in Lebanon, would threaten Israel and would make it more difficult for us to move on a path to have a transition that at some point would deal with Assad's future.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
599,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
600,SANDERS,I happen to think...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
601,O'MALLEY,I'd like to offer a...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
602,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
603,MUIR,She says we have to proceed on both fronts at once.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
604,SANDERS,Secretary Clinton is right.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
605,SANDERS,This is a complicated issue.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
606,SANDERS,I don't think anyone has a magical solution.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
607,SANDERS,But this is what I do believe.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
608,SANDERS,"Yes, of course Assad is a terrible dictator.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
609,SANDERS,But I think we have got to get our foreign policies and priorities right.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
610,SANDERS,The immediate -- it is not Assad who is attacking the United States.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
611,SANDERS,It is ISIS.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
612,SANDERS,And ISIS is attacking France and attacking Russian airliners.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
613,SANDERS,"The major priority, right now, in terms of our foreign and military policy should be the destruction of ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
614,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
615,SANDERS,"And I think -- and I think we bring together that broad coalition, including Russia, to help us destroy ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
616,SANDERS,"And work on a timetable to get rid of Assad, hopefully through Democratic elections.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
617,SANDERS,"First priority, destroy ISIS.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
618,MUIR,"Senator sanders, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
619,O'MALLEY,May I offer a different generation's perspective on this?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
620,MUIR,Governor O'Malley?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

621,O'MALLEY,"During the Cold War -- during the Cold War, we got into a bad habit of always looking to see who was wearing the jersey of the communists, and who was wearing the U.S. jersey.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
622,O'MALLEY,"We got into a bad habit of creating big bureaucracies, old methodologies, to undermine regimes that were not friendly to the United States.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
623,O'MALLEY,Look what we did in Iran with Mosaddegh.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
624,O'MALLEY,And look at the results that we're still dealing with because of that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

625,O'MALLEY,"I would suggest to you that we need to leave the Cold War behind us, and we need to put together new alliances and new approaches to dealing with this, and we need to restrain ourselves.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
626,O'MALLEY,"I mean, I know Secretary Clinton was gleeful when Gadhafi was torn apart.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
627,O'MALLEY,"And the world, no doubt is a better place without him.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
628,O'MALLEY,"But look, we didn't know what was happening next.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
629,O'MALLEY,"And we fell into the same trap with Assad, saying -- as if it's our job to say, Assad must go.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
630,O'MALLEY,We have a role to play in this world.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
631,O'MALLEY,But we need to leave the Cold War and that sort of antiquated thinking behind.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
632,MUIR,But -- you criticized -- you criticized Secretary Clinton for what came next.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
633,MUIR,What's your proposal for what comes after Assad?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
634,O'MALLEY,I believe that we need to focus on destroying ISIL.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
635,O'MALLEY,That is the clear and present danger.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

636,O'MALLEY,"And I believe that we can springboard off of this new U.N. resolution, and we should create, as Secretary Clinton indicated, and I agree with that, that there should be a political process.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
637,O'MALLEY,But we shouldn't be the ones declaring that Assad must go.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

638,O'MALLEY,"Where did it ever say in the Constitution, where is it written that it's the job of the United States of America or its secretary of State to determine when dictators have to go?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
639,O'MALLEY,We have a role to play in this world.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
640,O'MALLEY,But it is not the world -- the role of traveling the world looking for new monsters to destroy.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

643,CLINTON,Since he has been making all kinds of comments.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
644,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
645,CLINTON,"I think it's fair to say, Assad has killed, by last count, about 250,000 Syrians.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
646,CLINTON,"The reason we are in the mess we're in, that ISIS has the territory it has, is because of Assad.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

651,CLINTON,We now finally are where we need to be.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

679,MUIR,"We've already had a spirited conversation here at the top of the broadcast about ISIS, about the concerns of terror here on the homefront and as we await Secretary Clinton backstage, we're going to begin on the economy.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

681,MUIR,And we believe Secretary Clinton will be coming around the corner any minute.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
682,MUIR,But in the mean time we want to start with this eye-opening number.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
683,MUIR,"And Senator Sanders, this question goes to you first, anyway.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
684,MUIR,"In 1995, the median American household income was $52,600 in today's money.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

690,MUIR,"We're going to continue here, and Secretary, you'll get a chance on this too.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
691,MUIR,"But as I pointed out the CEO pay, 200 percent of their time -- for that family of just 2 percent.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
692,MUIR,"You've all said, ""you would raise the minimum wage.""",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
693,MUIR,But Senator Sanders what else - speak to that household tonight.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
694,MUIR,"20 years, just a 2 percent raise, how as president would you get them a raise right away?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
695,SANDERS,"First of all, we recognize that we have a rigged economy, as you've indicated.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
696,SANDERS,Middle class in this country for the last 40 years has been disappearing; are we better of today then we were when Bush left office?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
697,SANDERS,Absolutely.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

698,SANDERS,"But as you've indicated for millions of American workers, people in New Hampshire -- all over America, they're working longer hours for lower wages deeply worried about their kids.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
699,SANDERS,So what do we do?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
700,SANDERS,"First statement is, we tell the billionaire class, ""they cannot have it all.""",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
701,SANDERS,"For a start, they're going to start to pay their fair share of taxes.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
702,SANDERS,"Second of all what we do, is you raise the minimum wage to living wage, 15 bucks an hour over the next several years.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
703,SANDERS,"Next thing we do, pay equity for women workers.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
704,SANDERS,Women should not be making 79 cents on the dollar compared to that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
705,SANDERS,"Next thing that we do, real unemployment -- official unemployment, 5 percent, real employment 10 percent, youth unemployment, off the charts.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
706,SANDERS,"We rebuild our crumbling infrastructure, our roads our bridges, our rail systems, we create 13 million jobs with a trillion-dollar investment.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
707,SANDERS,"Furthermore, in a competitive global economy, it is imperative that we have the best educated workforce in the world.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
708,SANDERS,That is why I'm going to have a tax on Wall Street speculation to make certain that public colleges and universities in America are tuition free.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
709,MUIR,"Senator Sanders, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
710,MUIR,"Governor O'Malley, what would propose that would be different, how would you get the middle class a raise and without waiting another 20 years for another 2 percent.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
711,O'MALLEY,Look these are the things that we did in own state through the recession.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
712,O'MALLEY,We actually passed a living wage.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
713,O'MALLEY,We raised the minimum wage.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

714,O'MALLEY,"We actually raised it to the highest goals of any state in the nation also in minority and women participant goals because we understood that the way you reinvigorate and make fair market American capitalism work, is to make the choices and the investments that include more people more full in the economic success of your state.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
715,O'MALLEY,"All through the recession, we defended the highest median income in America and the second highest median income for African American families.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
716,O'MALLEY,How?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
717,O'MALLEY,By actually doing more for education.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
718,O'MALLEY,We increased education funding by 37 percent.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
719,O'MALLEY,We were the only state in American that went four years in a row without a penny increase in college tuition.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

720,O'MALLEY,We invested more in our infrastructure and we squared our shoulders to the great business opportunity of this era and that is moving our economy to a 100 percent clean electric energy future.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
721,O'MALLEY,"We created 2,000 new jobs in the solar industry and we fought every single day to adopt more inclusive economic practices.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
722,O'MALLEY,"So David, the conclusion of all of those things is this; they weren't hopes, they weren't dreams, they weren't amorphous goals out there.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
723,O'MALLEY,"We actually took action to do these things and as president, I have put forward 15 strategic goals that will make wages go up again for all American families.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
724,O'MALLEY,Universal national service is an option for every kid in America to cut youth employment.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

725,O'MALLEY,And I'm the only candidate on this stage to put forward a new agenda for America's cities so we can employ more people in the heart of great American cities and get them back to work.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
726,MUIR,"Governor, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

729,MUIR,"As you were walking in, I was talking about the median American household getting a two percent raise over the last 20 years, that CEO pay in that same time frame has gone up 200 percent.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

731,CLINTON,"Well, I've been talking to a lot of these families, and this is such an outrage, both because it's bad for our economy, we're a 70 percent consumption economy, people need to feel optimistic and confident, they need to believe their hard work is going to be rewarded, and it's bad for our democracy.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
732,CLINTON,"It's absolutely the case that if people feel that the game is rigged, that has consequences.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

733,CLINTON,"I think it's great standing up here with the senator and the governor talking about these issues, because you're not going to hear anything like this from any of the Republicans who are running for president.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
734,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
735,CLINTON,"They don't want to raise the minimum wage, they don't want to do anything to increase incomes.",1,20151219_3_dem.tsv

736,CLINTON,"At the center of my economic policy is raising incomes, because people haven't been able to get ahead, and the cost of everything, from college tuition to prescription drugs, has gone up.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
737,CLINTON,Of course we have to raise the minimum wage.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

738,CLINTON,"Of course we have to do more to incentivize profit sharing, like we see with Market Basket right here in New Hampshire and New England, where all of the employees get a chance to share in the profits.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
739,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
740,CLINTON,And we've got to do more on equal pay for equal work.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
741,CLINTON,That means pass the Paycheck Fairness Act so we have transparency about how much people are making.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
742,CLINTON,"That's the way to get women's wages up, and that's good for them and good for their families and good for our communities.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
743,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
744,CLINTON,And there is a lot we can do in college affordability.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
745,CLINTON,"I have debt-free tuition plans, free community college plans, getting student debt down.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
746,CLINTON,I also am very committed to getting the price of drugs down.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
747,CLINTON,And there's a lot.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
748,CLINTON,You can go to my website...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

750,CLINTON,"... hillaryclinton.com, and read about it.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

752,MUIR,"Secretary, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
753,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

758,MUIR,"But Secretary Clinton, I did want to ask you, the last time you ran for president, Fortune Magazine put you on its cover with the headline Business Loves Hillary, pointing out your support for many CEOs in corporate America.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
759,MUIR,"I'm curious, eight years later, should corporate America love Hillary Clinton?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
760,CLINTON,Everybody should.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
761,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
762,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
763,CLINTON,"Look, I have said I want to be the president for the struggling, the striving and the successful.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
764,CLINTON,"I want to make sure the wealthy pay their fair share, which they have not been doing.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
765,CLINTON,"I want the Buffett Rule to be in effect, where millionaires have to pay 30 percent tax rates instead of 10 percent to nothing in some cases.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
766,CLINTON,I want to make sure we rein in the excessive use of political power to feather the nest and support the super wealthy.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
767,CLINTON,But I also want to create jobs and I want to be a partner with the private sector.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
768,CLINTON,I'm particularly keen on creating jobs in small business.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
769,CLINTON,"My dad was a small businessman, a really small business.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
770,CLINTON,I want to do more to help incentivize and create more small businesses.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

771,CLINTON,"So if -- if people who are in the private sector know what I stand for, it's what I fought for as a senator, it's what I will do as president, and they want to be part of once again building our economy so it works for everybody, more power to them, because they are the kind of business leaders who understand that if we don't get the American economy moving and growing, we're not going to recognize our country and we're not going to give our kids the same opportunities that we had.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
772,MUIR,"Secretary, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

777,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

779,SANDERS,So Hillary and I have a difference.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
780,SANDERS,The CEOs of large multinationals may like Hillary.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
781,SANDERS,They ain't going to like me and Wall Street is going to like me even less.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
782,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
783,SANDERS,"And the reason for that is we've got to deal with the elephant in the room, which is the greed, recklessness and illegal behavior on Wall Street.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

784,SANDERS,"When you have six financial institutions in this country that issue two-thirds of the credit cards and one-third of the mortgages, when three out of four of them are larger today than when we bailed them out because they are too big to fail, we've got to re- establish Glass-Steagall, we have got to break the large financial institutions up.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
785,SANDERS,So I don't think...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
786,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
787,SANDERS,"... having said that, I don't think I'm going to get a whole lot of campaign contributions from Wall Street.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
788,SANDERS,I don't have a super PAC.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
789,SANDERS,I don't want campaign contributions from corporate America.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

790,SANDERS,"And let me be clear: While there are some great corporations creating jobs and trying to do the right thing, in my view -- and I say this very seriously -- the greed of the billionaire class, the greed of Wall Street is destroying this economy and is destroying the lives of millions of Americans.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
791,SANDERS,"We need an economy that works for the middle class, not just a handful of billionaires, and I will fight and lead to make that happen.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

793,MUIR,I want to...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

796,MUIR,"Governor, let me just ask you, though, because it is an important question, how important a role do you think corporate America plays in a healthy economy here in the U.S.?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
797,O'MALLEY,"Look, I look at our economy as an ecosystem.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
798,O'MALLEY,"And the fact of the matter is that the more fully people participate, the more our workers earn, the more they will spend, the more our economy will grow.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
799,O'MALLEY,"And most heads of businesses -- large, medium and small -- understand that.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
800,O'MALLEY,But there is a better way forward than either of those offered by my two opponents here on this stage.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

801,O'MALLEY,"We're not going to fix what ails our economy, we're not going to make wages go up for everyone by either trying to replace American capitalism with socialism -- which, by the way, the rest of the world is moving away from -- nor will we fix it by submitting to sort of Wall Street-directed crony capitalism.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
802,O'MALLEY,"And for my part, I have demonstrated the ability to have the backbone to take on Wall Street in ways that Secretary Clinton never, ever has.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
803,O'MALLEY,"In fact, in the last debate, very shamefully, she tried to hide her cozy relationship with Wall Street big banks by invoking the attacks of 9/11.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
804,O'MALLEY,I believe that the way forward for our country is to actually reinvigorate our antitrust department with the directive to promote fair competition.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
805,O'MALLEY,There's mergers that are happening in every aspect of our country that is bad for competition and it's bad for -- for upward mobility of wages.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

806,O'MALLEY,"And the worst type of concentration, Secretary Clinton, is the concentration of the big banks, the big six banks that you went to and spoke to and told them, oh, you weren't responsible for the crash, not by a long shot.",1,20151219_3_dem.tsv

807,O'MALLEY,"And that's why today you still cannot support, as I do, breaking up the big banks and making sure that we pass a modern-day Glass- Steagall, like we had in late 1999, before it was repealed and led to the crash, where so many millions of families lost their jobs and their homes.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
808,O'MALLEY,"And I was on the front lines of that, looking into the eyes of my neighbors...",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
810,MUIR,"Governor O'Malley, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
811,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
812,MUIR,"I do want to ask you, Secretary Clinton.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
813,MUIR,Let me just ask you...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
814,CLINTON,Let me respond...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
815,MUIR,"We did -- we did -- Secretary Clinton, let me just ask you...",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
816,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
817,CLINTON,"Under the rules, I have been -- I have been invoked, David, so let me respond very quickly.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
818,CLINTON,Number one...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
819,MUIR,And in particular...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
820,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
821,CLINTON,"Number one, there are currently two hedge fund billionaires running ads against me here in New Hampshire.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
822,CLINTON,They started in Iowa.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
823,CLINTON,"Now, you'd have to ask yourself, why are they running ads against me?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
824,CLINTON,"And the answer is: Because they know I will go right after them, that I will not let their agenda be America's agenda.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
825,CLINTON,"Secondly, I think it's important to point out that about 3 percent of my donations come from people in the finance and investment world.",1,20151219_3_dem.tsv
826,CLINTON,You can go to opensecrets.org and check that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
827,CLINTON,I have more donations from students and teachers than I do from people associated with Wall Street.,1,20151219_3_dem.tsv
828,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

829,CLINTON,"Now, number three -- and let me say this -- when Governor O'Malley was heading the Democratic Governors Association, he had no trouble at all going to Wall Street to raise money to run campaigns for Democratic governors.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
830,CLINTON,And he also had no trouble appointing an investment banker to be in charge of his consumer protection bureau when he was governor.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
831,CLINTON,"So, you know, again, the difference between us and the Republicans is night and day.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

832,CLINTON,"And there is only one person on this stage who voted to take away authority from the SEC and the Commodities Future Trading Commission that they could no longer regulate what are called swaps and derivatives, which actually contributed to the collapse of Lehman Brothers, and that was Senator Sanders.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

833,CLINTON,"So if we're going to be talking like this, we can -- and maybe we can score some political points -- but the fact is: Every one of us stands for the kind of economy that will work better for every American.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

834,CLINTON,"And if that means taking on Wall Street, I have a plan that is tough and comprehensive and praised by a lot of folks who say it goes further than what both Senator Sanders and Governor O'Malley are proposing.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
835,SANDERS,Let me just -- let me just...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
836,MUIR,"Secretary Clinton, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
837,SANDERS,Let me just jump in.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

841,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
842,SANDERS,"Secretary Clinton, I don't have a super PAC.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

873,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

875,CLINTON,But out-of-pocket costs have gone up too much and prescription drug costs have gone through the roof.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
876,CLINTON,"And so what I have proposed, number one, is a $5,000 tax credit to help people who have very large out-of-pocket costs be able to afford those.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

878,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
879,CLINTON,We end up paying the highest prices in the world.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

949,SANDERS,And I understand in many universities a heck of a lot of vice presidents who earn a big salary.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

979,O'MALLEY,Bill.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
980,O'MALLEY,"But today, we're the only nation on the planet that's saddling our kids with a lifetime of bills.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

993,CLINTON,"So under my compact, the federal government will match money that the states begin to put back in to the higher education system.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
