1065,MUIR,I want to bring in Governor O'Malley on this.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1066,MUIR,"We heard the promise from Secretary Clinton because people want to know about their taxes, will they go up.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1067,MUIR,"She has now promised here tonight not to raise them on families making $250,000 or less.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1068,MUIR,Can you make that same promise if you're elected?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1069,O'MALLEY,"No, I've never made a promise like that.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1070,O'MALLEY,"But unlike either of these two fine people, I've actually balanced a budget every single year.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1071,O'MALLEY,I was one -- I was the only -- one of only seven states that had a AAA bond rating.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1072,O'MALLEY,"By the time I left, the average tax burden on Maryland families was the same as when I started.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1073,O'MALLEY,But I did pass a more progressive income tax and asked the highest-earning people to pay another 14 percent.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1074,O'MALLEY,"David, look, this is the big -- I agree, by the way, that we should have paid family leave.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1075,O'MALLEY,And I agree with Senator Sanders on that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1076,O'MALLEY,"And just like Social Security and unlike the Republicans, I think we should actually expand Social Security and increase average monthly benefits.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1077,O'MALLEY,"But look, there's one big entitlement we can no longer afford as a country, and that is the entitlement that the super wealthy among us, those earning more than a million dollars, feel that they're entitled to pay lower income tax rates and a far lower preferred income tax rate when it comes to capital gains.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1078,O'MALLEY,"If we were to raise the marginal rate to 45 percent for people earning more than a million dollars and if we tax capital gains essentially the same we do earnings from hard work and sweat and toil, you could generate $800 billion over the next ten years and that would do so much good for affordable college, debt-free college, cutting youth unemployment in half, investing in our cities again.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1079,O'MALLEY,So the things I have done in office are the things that actually invest in growing our economy and making wages go up.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1080,O'MALLEY,"That's the issue that we need to tackle as Americans, and we can do it and we know how.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1081,MUIR,"Governor O'Malley, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1082,MUIR,A spirited debate on taxes.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1083,MUIR,"And there will be more with the Democratic debate in New Hampshire, when we come back right here on ABC.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1084,MUIR,More in a moment.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1085,SYSTEM,(COMMERCIAL BREAK),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1086,MUIR,Welcome back tonight to New Hampshire.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1087,MUIR,The Democratic debate continues here on ABC.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1088,MUIR,"And Secretary Clinton, we want to turn to race, now, in America.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1089,MUIR,"There is a real concern in this country from Black Lives Matter and from other community groups that we're just now seeing, with smartphones and cell phones, what many have been dealing with for years when they come in contact with police.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1090,MUIR,"But you also have many in law enforcement who now say there has been a so-called Ferguson effect, police holding back because they're afraid of backlash.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1091,MUIR,"In fact, the FBI director is calling it a chill wind blowing through American law enforcement.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1092,MUIR,"So, if elected president, how would you bridge the divide between the two?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1093,CLINTON,"Well, David, I think this is one of the most important challenges facing not just our next president but our country.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1094,CLINTON,"We have systemic racism and injustice and inequities in our country and in particular, in our justice system that must be addressed and must be ended.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1095,CLINTON,I feel very strongly that we have to reform our criminal justice system and we have to find ways to try to bring law enforcement together again with the communities that they are sworn to protect.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1096,CLINTON,Trust has been totally lost in a lot of places.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1097,CLINTON,"At the same time, we know that in many parts of our country police officers are bridging those divides and they're acting heroically.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1098,CLINTON,The young officer who was killed responding to the Planned Parenthood murders.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1099,CLINTON,The officer who told the victims of the San Bernardino killings that he would take a bullet before them.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1100,CLINTON,So I think that we need to build on the work of the policing commissioner that President Obama impaneled.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1101,CLINTON,We need to get a bipartisan commitment to work together on this.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1102,CLINTON,"And we need to hear the voices of those men and women and boys and girls who feel like strangers in their own country and do whatever is necessary to not only deal with the immediate problems within the criminal justice system, but more opportunities, more jobs, better education so that we can begin to rebuild that very valuable asset known as trust.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1103,MUIR,"Secretary, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1104,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1105,MUIR,"Governor O'Malley, how would you bridge the divide?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1106,O'MALLEY,"There is no issue in American public policy that I have worked on more day in and day out than this painful issue of policing, of law enforcement, criminal justice and race in America.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1107,O'MALLEY,"When I ran in 1999, David, for mayor of Baltimore, our city by that year had become the most addicted, violent, and abandoned in America.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1108,O'MALLEY,But we came together.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1109,O'MALLEY,I brought people together over some very deep racial divides.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1110,O'MALLEY,And we were able to put our city on the path for the biggest reduction in crime of any major city in America over the next ten years.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1111,O'MALLEY,"As governor, we continued to work together.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1112,O'MALLEY,We reduced violent crime to 30-year lows.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1113,O'MALLEY,But get this.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1114,O'MALLEY,We also reduced incarceration rates to 20-year lows.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1115,O'MALLEY,"So it is possible actually, to find the things that actually work, that we did, increasing drug treatment, using big data to better protect the lives of young people, cut juvenile crime in half, and it's also possible to improve how we police our police.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1116,O'MALLEY,But there wasn't a single day as mayor of Baltimore that I wasn't asked whether I was delivering on the promise I made to police the police.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1117,O'MALLEY,"We reported excessive force, discourtesy, use of lethal force.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1118,O'MALLEY,"In fact, drove down to three of the four lowest years on record police use of lethal force.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1119,O'MALLEY,"As a nation, we have to embrace this moment and make our departments more open, more transparent, and more accountable.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1120,O'MALLEY,"Just as we require every major department, every county to report its major crimes, we should require police departments to report their discourtesy, brutality, excessive force.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1121,O'MALLEY,"There's so much work that can be done, so much we've learned to do better.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1122,O'MALLEY,We need to do it now as a nation.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1123,O'MALLEY,This is our time and our opportunity to do that.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1124,MUIR,"Governor, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1125,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1126,MUIR,"And Senator Sanders, when you hear the FBI director calling it a chill wind blowing through American law enforcement, does that concern you as well when you --",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1127,SANDERS,"Well, this whole issue concerns me.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1128,SANDERS,And I agree with much of what the secretary and the governor have said.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1129,SANDERS,But let's be clear.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1130,SANDERS,"Today in America we have more people in jail than any other country on earth, 2.2 million people.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1131,SANDERS,Predominantly African-American and Hispanic.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1132,SANDERS,We are spending $80 billion a year locking up our fellow Americans.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1133,SANDERS,"I think, and this is not easy, but I think we need to make wage a major effort, to come together as a country and end institutional racism.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1134,SANDERS,"We need major, major reforms of a very broken criminal justice system.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1135,SANDERS,"Now, what does that mean?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1136,SANDERS,"Well, for a start it means that police officers should not be shooting unarmed people, predominantly African-Americans.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1137,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1138,SANDERS,"It means that we have to rethink the so-called war on drugs which has destroyed the lives of millions of people, which is why I have taken marijuana out of the Controlled Substance Act.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1139,SANDERS,So that it will not be a federal crime.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1140,SANDERS,That is why we need to make...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1141,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1142,SANDERS,That is why we need to make police -- and I speak as a former mayor.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1143,SANDERS,"I was a mayor for eight years, worked very closely with a great police department.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1144,SANDERS,"And what we did is try to move that department toward community policing, so that the police officers become part of the community and not, as we see, in some cities an oppressive force.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1145,SANDERS,We need to make police departments look like the communities they serve in terms of diversity.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1146,SANDERS,We need to end minimal sentencing.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1147,SANDERS,"We need, basically, to pledge that we're going to invest in this country, in jobs and education, not more jails and incarceration.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1148,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1149,MUIR,"Senator, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1150,MUIR,We want to turn now to an issue.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1151,MUIR,"This next issue has destroyed so many families across the country, and in particular right here in New Hampshire, heroin.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1152,MUIR,And there's a stunning new figure out.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1153,MUIR,"A recent poll -- 48 percent here, in this state alone, say they know someone who has abused heroin.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1154,MUIR,We're going to turn tonight to Dan Tuohy of the New Hampshire Union Leader who has this question.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1155,QUESTION,"New Hampshire has been hard hit by the heroin epidemic, and we're on track to have twice as many overdose deaths this year as in 2013.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1156,QUESTION,What specifically would you do to address this crisis?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1157,MUIR,"Senator Sanders, I'm going to take this to you first because you've seen what's happened with heroin right on the border in your own state.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1158,SANDERS,Yes.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1159,SANDERS,"Look, this is a tragedy for New Hampshire.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1160,SANDERS,It is a tragedy for my state of Vermont.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1161,SANDERS,It is a tragedy all over this country.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1162,SANDERS,"The number of heroin deaths are growing very, very significantly.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1163,SANDERS,What do we do?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1164,SANDERS,"Well, for a start, this may seem like a radical idea, but I think we have got to tell the medical profession and doctors who are prescribing opiates and the pharmaceutical industry that they have got to start getting their act together, we cannot have this huge number of opiates out there throughout this country, where young people are taking them, getting hooked, and then going to heroin.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1165,SANDERS,"Second of all, and the reason I believe in a health care for all program, we need to understand that addiction is a disease, not a criminal activity.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1166,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1167,SANDERS,And that means -- and that means radically changing the way we deal with mental health and addiction issues.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1168,SANDERS,"When somebody is addicted and seeking help, they should not have to wait three, four months in order to get that help.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1169,SANDERS,They should be able to walk in the door tomorrow and get a variety of treatments that work for them.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1170,SANDERS,So those are some of the areas that I think we've got to move on.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1171,MUIR,"Senator, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1172,MUIR,Secretary Clinton?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1173,CLINTON,"You know, on my very first visit to New Hampshire in this campaign, I was in Keene, and I was asked what are you going to do about the heroin epidemic?",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1174,CLINTON,"And all over New Hampshire, I met grandmothers who are raising children because they lost the father or the mother to an overdose.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1175,CLINTON,"I met young people who are desperately trying to get clean and have nowhere to go, because there are not enough facilities.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1176,CLINTON,"So this is a major epidemic, and it has hit New Hampshire and Vermont particularly hard.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1177,CLINTON,"I've had had two town halls, one in Keene, one in Laconia, dedicated exclusively to talking about what we can do.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1178,CLINTON,"And I've heard some great ideas about how law enforcement is changing its behavior, how the recovery community is reaching out.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1179,CLINTON,"And I was proud to get the endorsement of Mayor Walsh of Boston, who has made his struggle with alcoholism a real clarion call for action in this arena.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1180,CLINTON,"So, I've laid out a five-point plan about what we can do together.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1181,CLINTON,"I would like the federal government to offer $10 billion over ten years to work with states, and I really applaud Governor Hassan for taking up this challenge and working with the legislature here to come up with a plan.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1182,CLINTON,We need to do more on the prescribing end of it.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1183,CLINTON,"There are too many opioids being prescribed, and that leads directly now to heroin addiction.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1184,CLINTON,"And we need to change the way we do law enforcement, and of course, we need more programs and facilities, so when somebody is ready to get help, there's a place for them to go.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1185,CLINTON,"And every law enforcement should carry the antidote to overdose, Naloxone, so that they can save lives that are on the brink of expiring.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1186,MUIR,"Secretary, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1187,O'MALLEY,"And you know, I actually know a great deal about this issue.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1188,O'MALLEY,"And I have a dear friend, played music with him for years, remember when his -- when he came home with his baby girl, and now she's no longer with us, because of addiction and overdose.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1189,O'MALLEY,"The last time in New Hampshire, I had to take a break shortly after landing and call home and comfort a friend whose mother had died of an overdose.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1190,O'MALLEY,Drugs have taken far too many of our citizens.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1191,O'MALLEY,It's a huge public health challenge.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1192,O'MALLEY,"In our own city, I mentioned before, we had become the most addicted city in America.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1193,O'MALLEY,"But together, every single year, I expanded drug treatment funding within our city and then I expanded it in our state, and we were saving lives every single year doing the things that work, intervening earlier, understanding the continuum of care that's required until we got hit like every other state in the state -- in the United States, especially in New Hampshire and in the northeast with this opioid addiction, the over-prescribing.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1194,O'MALLEY,"I agree, we need better -- we need to rein in the over- prescribing, but I have put forward on my -- in my plan a $12 billion federal investment.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1195,O'MALLEY,"We have to invest in the local partnerships, and the best place to intervene, the best indicator of when a person is actually on the verge of killing themselves because of an addiction, is at the hospital.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1196,O'MALLEY,"That very first time they show up with a near miss, we should be intervening there.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1197,O'MALLEY,That's what I said to my own public health people.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1198,O'MALLEY,What would we do if this were ebola?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1199,O'MALLEY,How would we act?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1200,O'MALLEY,"So many more Americans have been killed by the combination of heroin and these highly addictive pain pills, and yet, we refuse to act.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1201,O'MALLEY,There are thing that can be done.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1202,O'MALLEY,Go on to my website.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1203,O'MALLEY,My plan is there.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1204,O'MALLEY,It's one of 15 strategic goals I've set out to make our country a better place by cutting these sort of deaths in half in the next five years.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1205,MUIR,"Governor O'Malley, thank you.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1206,MUIR,Martha?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1207,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1208,RADDATZ,"Secretary Clinton, I want to circle back to something that your opponents here have brought up.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1209,RADDATZ,Libya is falling apart.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1210,RADDATZ,"The country is a haven for ISIS and jihadists with an estimated 2,000 ISIS fighters there today.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1211,RADDATZ,You advocated for that 2011 intervention and called it smart power at its best.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1212,RADDATZ,"And yet, even President Obama said the U.S. should have done more to fill the leadership vacuum left behind.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1213,RADDATZ,How much responsibility do you bear for the chaos that followed elections?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1214,CLINTON,"Well, first, let's remember why we became part of a coalition to stop Gadhafi from committing massacres against his people.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1215,CLINTON,"The United States was asked to support the Europeans and the Arab partners that we had and we did a lot of due diligence about whether we should or not, and eventually, yes, I recommended and the president decided that we would support the action to protect civilians on the ground and that led to the overthrow of Gadhafi.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1216,CLINTON,"I think that what Libya then did by having a full free election, which elected moderates, was an indication of their crying need and desire to get on the right path.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1217,CLINTON,"Now, the whole region has been rendered unstable, in part because of the aftermath of the Arab Spring, in part because of the very effective outreach and propagandizing that ISIS and other terrorist groups do.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1218,CLINTON,"But what we're seeing happening in Libya right now is that there has been a fragile agreement to put aside the differences that exist among Libyans themselves to try to dislodge ISIS from Sirte, the home town of Gadhafi, and to begin to try to create a national government.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1219,CLINTON,"You know, this is not easy work.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1220,CLINTON,We did a lot to help.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1221,CLINTON,We did as much as we could because the Libyans themselves had very strong feelings about what they wished to accept.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1222,CLINTON,But we're always looking for ways about what more we can do to try to give people a chance to be successful.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1223,RADDATZ,"Secretary Clinton, I want to go back.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1224,RADDATZ,That -- government lacked institutions and experience.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1225,RADDATZ,It had been a family business for 40 years.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1226,RADDATZ,"On the security side, we offered only a modest training effort and a very limited arms buy-back program.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1227,RADDATZ,Let me ask you the question again.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1228,RADDATZ,How much responsibility do you bear for the chaos that followed those elections?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1229,CLINTON,"Martha, we offered a lot more than they were willing to take.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1230,CLINTON,We offered a lot more.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1231,CLINTON,"We also got rid of their chemical weapons, which was a big help, and we also went after a lot of the shoulder-fired missiles to round them up.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1232,CLINTON,"You know, we can't -- if we're not going to send American troops, which there was never any idea of doing that, then to try to send trainers, to try to send experts, is something we offered, Europeans offered, the U.N. offered, and there wasn't a lot of responsiveness at first.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1233,CLINTON,"I think a lot of the Libyans who had been forced out of their country by Gadhafi who came back to try to be part of a new government, believed they knew what to do and it turned out that they were no match for some of the militaristic forces inside that country.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1234,CLINTON,But I'm not giving up on Libya and I don't think anybody should.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1235,CLINTON,We've been at this a couple of years.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1236,RADDATZ,But were mistakes made?,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1237,CLINTON,"Well, there's always a retrospective to say what mistakes were made.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1238,CLINTON,But I know that we offered a lot of help and I know it was difficult for the Libyans to accept help.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1239,CLINTON,What we could have done if they had said yes would have been a lot more than what we were able to have done.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1240,SANDERS,But what...,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1241,RADDATZ,Senator Sanders.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1242,SANDERS,"Look, the secretary is right.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1243,SANDERS,This is a terribly complicated issue.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1244,SANDERS,There are no simple solutions.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1245,SANDERS,"But where we have a disagreement is that I think if you look at the history of regime changes, you go back to Mossaddegh (ph) in Iran, you go back to Salvador Allende who we overthrew in Chile, you go back to overthrowing Saddam Hussein in Iraq, you go back to where we are today in Syria with a dictator named Assad.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1246,SANDERS,The truth is it is relatively easy for a powerful nation like America to overthrow a dictator but it is very hard to predict the unintended consequences and the turmoil and the instability that follows after you overthrow that dictator.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1247,SANDERS,So I think secretary Clinton and I have a fundamental disagreement.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1248,SANDERS,I'm not quite the fan of regime change that I believe she is.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1249,O'MALLEY,Martha -- I would just repeat that --,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1250,CLINTON,"Well, I would just repeat that.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1251,RADDATZ,Secretary Clinton.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1252,CLINTON,Wait a minute.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1253,CLINTON,"I think it's only fair to put on the record, Senator Sanders voted in the Senate for a resolution calling for ending the Gadhafi regime and asking that the U.N. be brought in, either a congressional vote or a U.N. Security Council vote.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1254,CLINTON,We got a U.N. Security council vote.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1255,CLINTON,"Now, I understand that this is very difficult.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1256,CLINTON,And I'm not standing here today and saying that Libya is as far along as Tunisia.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1257,CLINTON,We saw what happened in Egypt.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1258,CLINTON,"I cautioned about a quick overthrow of Mubarak, and we now are back with basically an army dictatorship.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1259,CLINTON,This is a part of the world where the United States has tried to play two different approaches.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1260,CLINTON,"One, work with the tough men, the dictators, for our own benefit and promote democracy.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1261,CLINTON,That's a hard road to walk.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv
1262,CLINTON,But I think it's the right road for us to try to travel.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1269,O'MALLEY,"But without the tools, without the support that was needed to that.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1278,RADDATZ,"Secretary Clinton, first ladies, as you well know, have used their position to work on important causes like literacy and drug abuse.",0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1284,CLINTON,And I am very grateful for all my predecessors and my successors because each of them not only did what she could to support her husband and our country but often chose to work on important issues that were of particular concern.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

1286,CLINTON,And I think has had a big impact.,0,20151219_3_dem.tsv

546,BAIER,"Governor Bush, just today, a wounded warrior organization designed to help wounded veterans and their families is coming under fire for raising tens of millions of dollars, but spending almost half of that on travel and hotels and dinners and luxury, lavish conferences.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
547,BAIER,So taking care of veterans is obviously a huge issue in the country that has asked so many to serve and sacrifice so much.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
548,BAIER,If you were president.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
549,BAIER,would you police these charity organizations that say they're helping vets?,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
550,BUSH,Of course.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
551,BUSH,"And there's all sorts of ways that can be done at the state, local and federal level to do that.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
552,BUSH,But the first duty of the next president of the United States is to fix the mess at the Department of Veterans Affairs.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
553,BUSH,That's his first responsibility.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
554,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
555,BUSH,"Look, we have waiting lists for veterans that are -- that are leaving because of the sequester where we're gutting the military.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
556,BUSH,"More and more military personnel are leaving becoming veterans, and the waiting list grows.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
557,BUSH,"They've given out $140 million of bonuses to Veterans Department employees, including reducing the waiting lists, without giving veterans care.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
558,BUSH,"People died, and only three people have been fired.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

559,BUSH,I will make sure that we fire the sheer incompetence inside the Department of Veterans Affairs and then we'll give veterans a choice card so that they don't have to travel hours and hours to get care if they want to go to their private provider.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
560,BUSH,"You want to make the Veterans Administration do a better job, give them -- give veterans choices and you'll get a much better result.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
561,BUSH,"And as it relates to all the other organizations, let me give you a good example.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
562,BUSH,"In Houston, Texas, there's an organization in place because someone acted on their heart, wanted to make sure that there's no homeless veterans in Houston.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
563,BUSH,And they've come pretty close to that without federal government assistance.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
564,BUSH,We need to mobilize the entire country to treat our veterans and treat them with much more respect than they get today.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

573,QUESTION,"Now, there are great tools like body cameras that -- to protect both officers and citizens, but we all currently have better cameras in our pockets than in our precincts.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

577,PAUL,"I've been to Ferguson, I've been trying to look for solutions to our criminal justice problem.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
578,PAUL,One thing I discovered in Ferguson was that a third of the budget for the city of Ferguson was being reaped by civil fines.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
579,PAUL,People were just being fined to death.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
580,PAUL,"Now you and I and many of the people in this audience, if we get a $100 fine, we can survive it.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
581,PAUL,"If you're living on the edge of poverty and you get a $100 fine or your car towed, a lot of times you lose your job.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

582,PAUL,"I also think the war on drugs has disproportionately affected our African-American community, and what we need to do is make sure that the war on drugs is equal protection under the law and that we don't unfairly incarcerate another generation of young African-American males.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
583,PAUL,"In Ferguson, for every 100 African-American women, there are only 60 African-American men.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
584,PAUL,"Drug use is about equal between white and black, but our prisons -- three out of four people in prison are black or brown.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
585,PAUL,I think something has to change.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
586,PAUL,"I think it's a big thing that our party needs to be part of, and I've been a leader in Congress on trying to bring about criminal justice reform.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

618,BAIER,"And, Governor, I realize everyone on this stage opposes Obamacare and you're not alone.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

624,CRUZ,Sure.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
625,CRUZ,"Well, let's take it one at a time.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
626,CRUZ,"First of all, we have seen now in six years of Obamacare that it has been a disaster.",1,20160129_7_gop.tsv
627,CRUZ,It is the biggest job-killer in this country.,1,20160129_7_gop.tsv

628,CRUZ,"Millions of Americans have lost their jobs, have been forced into part-time work, have lost their health insurance, have lost their doctors, have seen their premiums skyrocket.",1,20160129_7_gop.tsv
629,CRUZ,"If I'm elected president, we will repeal every word of Obamacare.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

631,CRUZ,"Now, once that is done, everyone agrees we need healthcare reform.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
632,CRUZ,"It should follow the principles of expanding competition, empowering patients, and keeping government from getting in between us and our doctors.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
633,CRUZ,Three specific reforms that reflect those principles.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
634,CRUZ,"Number one, we should allow people to purchase health insurance across state lines.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
635,CRUZ,"That will create a true 50-state national marketplace which will drive down the cost of low-cost, catastrophic health insurance.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

646,BUSH,And I believe that Puerto Rico ought to have the right of self-determination.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

684,BAIER,"Senator Rubio, on the issue of climate change, in 2008, you wanted Florida to get ahead of other states and establish a cap- and-trade system, a program for carbon emissions, which many Republicans thought at the time would hurt the Florida economy.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
685,BAIER,"Now, you're a skeptic of climate change science.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

688,RUBIO,"Well, Bret, first that's not entirely the story.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
689,RUBIO,"At the time, the liberal governor of Florida, who claimed he was a Republican -- his name was Charlie Crist -- he wanted to impose cap-and-trade on Florida.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
690,RUBIO,And I opposed it.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
691,RUBIO,I was the first person out of the box that opposed him on it.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
692,RUBIO,"And then we saw that the leading candidates for president at the time, both the Republican and the Democrats, all supported it.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
693,RUBIO,"And what we said is, if they're going to impose this on us, we better prepare to protect the state from it.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
694,RUBIO,But I have never supported cap- and-trade and I never thought it was a good idea.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
695,RUBIO,And I was clear about that at the time.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
696,RUBIO,And I do not believe it's a good idea now.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
697,RUBIO,I do not believe that we have to destroy our economy in order to protect our environment.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
698,RUBIO,"And especially what these programs are asking us to pass that will do nothing to help the environment, but will be devastating for our economy.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
699,RUBIO,"When I am president of the United States of America, there will never be any cap-and-trade in the United States.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1000,CURZ,"Well, Chris, you are exactly right that I am not the candidate of career politicians in Washington.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1001,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1002,CRUZ,"And I'll tell you the endorsements that I am proud of are the over 200,000 volunteers across this country who have signed up to volunteer for our campaign.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1006,CRUZ,Washington is broken.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1007,"And the people I have been accountable to every single day in the Senate are the 27 million Texans who I represent and I made a promise to them that I make to you today, which is, if I am elected, every single day I will do two things","tell the truth, and do what I said I would do.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1010,KELLY,"Governor bush, poll after poll shows you running among the worst in your party against Hillary Clinton.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1011,KELLY,Even Mitt Romney said that a Bush v. Clinton head-to-head would be too easy for the Democrats.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1012,KELLY,"Yet still you and the super PACs supporting you continue to blanket the airwaves with cutting ads, not against Mrs. Clinton, but against your fellow Republicans, especially Senator Rubio.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1013,KELLY,Do these attacks do more harm than good by targeting those candidates who appear to have the best chance of defeating Mrs. Clinton?,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1014,BUSH,"Well, first of all, I've seen polls where I'm beating Hillary Clinton pretty regularly.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1015,BUSH,"And I believe I can, because I have a proven record, a record of accomplishment, a record of cutting taxes, of shrinking the government, of reforming education, of challenging the status quo, eliminating career civil service protections, shrinking the government workforce by 11 percent, but leading the nation in job growth.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1016,BUSH,"That's the record of accomplishment that should be taken to Hillary Clinton, who has no record of accomplishment.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1017,BUSH,"So I'm confident if I win this nomination, I will aggressively go against her and beat her.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1018,BUSH,"As it relates to the super PACs, I have no control over that.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1019,BUSH,And this is beanbag compared to what the Clinton hit machine is going to do to the Republican nominee.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1020,BUSH,"The simple fact is, we all have a record.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1021,BUSH,It all will be scrutinized.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1022,BUSH,There's give and take.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1023,BUSH,It's called the politics.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1024,BUSH,And that's the way it is.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1028,RUBIO,"Well, I believe, and I know that if Iowa helps make me the Republican nominee, I will defeat Hillary Clinton.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1031,RUBIO,She wants to put Barack Obama on the Supreme Court of the United States of America.,1,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1033,RUBIO,That would be a disaster for this country.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1044,RUBIO,And so -- and I've always made that clear about that cover story.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1075,CHRISTIE,"And, there is no one on this stage better prepared to prosecute the case against Hillary Clinton than I am.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1076,CHRISTIE,I will be ready.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1077,CHRISTIE,"I will take her on, and when I take her on I guarantee you one thing, she will never get within 10 miles of the White House.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1098,KASICH,Because I don't think they ought to live in prison or live under a bridge; to treat the drug-addicted so they're not in an in-and-out-of- the-door policy out of the prisons; and to help the working poor so they don't live in emergency rooms.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1109,KASICH,Because we don't want them in and out -- we don't want them in and out of the prisons.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1123,WALLACE,"Gentlemen, we had a case study on religious liberty just this last summer.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1124,WALLACE,"A county clerk in Kentucky named Kim Davis refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples after the Supreme Court ruling, saying that it violated her religious beliefs.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1125,WALLACE,"Governor Christie, you said that she must follow the law or be moved to another job that would be in keeping with her conscience.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1126,WALLACE,But some conservatives say that that violates her religious liberty.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1127,CHRISTIE,"No, what I said, Chris, was that the law needs to be followed.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1128,CHRISTIE,And that someone in that office has to do their job.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1129,CHRISTIE,"So if Ms. Davis wanted to step aside and get rid of her ability to be able to do that, there should be someone else in that office who it didn't violate their conscience so they could follow the law of the state of Kentucky.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1130,CHRISTIE,I never said that Ms. Davis should either lose her job or that she had to do it.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1131,CHRISTIE,But what I did say was that the person who came in for the license needed to get it.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1132,CHRISTIE,"And so if there's someone in that organization, and it turns out there was, who was willing to be able to do that, that's what we should do.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1133,CHRISTIE,"But just as importantly, and I agree with what John said.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1134,CHRISTIE,"You know, we all have our own individual interpretations of our faith.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1135,CHRISTIE,And here's the problem with what's going on around the world.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1136,CHRISTIE,"The radical Islamic jihadists, what they want to do is impose their faith upon each and every one of us -- every one of us.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1137,CHRISTIE,And the reason why this war against them is so important is that very basis of religious liberty.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1138,CHRISTIE,They want everyone in this country to follow their religious beliefs the way they do.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1139,CHRISTIE,They do not want us to exercise religious liberty.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1140,CHRISTIE,"That's why as commander in chief, I will take on ISIS, not only because it keeps us safe, but because it allows us to absolutely conduct our religious affairs the way we find in our heart and in our souls.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1141,CHRISTIE,"As a Catholic, that's what I want to do.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1142,CHRISTIE,"And no matter what your faith is, that's what I want you to be able to do.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1145,WALLACE,"Senator Rubio, during the last debate, you said Governor Christie had changed his position and his mind on gun control, on common core, and backing President Obama's nomination of Sonia Sotomayor to the Supreme Court.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1146,WALLACE,"He said you're wrong on the facts and you can't, quote, ""slime your way to the White House.""",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1147,WALLACE,"I assume in the last two weeks, you've done some fact-checking.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1148,WALLACE,Do you want to take anything back?,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1149,RUBIO,"Yeah, I would encourage people to go on my website, marcorubio.com, and we'll put all the facts up there so people can see it for themselves.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1150,RUBIO,But you've just asked a very fundamental question about the role of faith in our country.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1151,RUBIO,And I think this is an important question.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1152,RUBIO,"I think if you do not understand that our Judeo-Christian values are one of the reasons why America is such a special country, you don't understand our history.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1153,RUBIO,"You see, why are we one of the most generous people in the world -- no, the most generous people in the world?",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1154,RUBIO,Why do Americans contribute millions of dollars to charity?,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1155,RUBIO,It is not because of the tax writeoff.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1156,RUBIO,"It is because in this nation, we are influenced by Judeo-Christian values that teach us to care for the less fortunate, to reach out to the needy, to love our neighbor.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1157,RUBIO,This is what's made our nation so special.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1158,RUBIO,And you should hope that our next president is someone that is influence by their faith.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1159,RUBIO,"Because if your faith causes you to care for the less fortunate, it is something you want to see in your public figures.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1160,RUBIO,"And when I'm president, I can tell you this, my faith will not just influence the way I'll govern as president, it will influence the way I live my life.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1161,RUBIO,"Because in the end, my goal is not simply to live on this earth for 80 years, but to live an eternity with my creator.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1162,RUBIO,And I will always allow my faith to influence everything I do.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1164,WALLACE,"Thank you, senator.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1165,WALLACE,"Senator Paul, in May on the campaign trail you, said you didn't get into politics to fight about abortion.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1166,WALLACE,You said you were more concerned about the national debt.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1167,WALLACE,Your answer is to turn abortion back to the states the way it was before Roe v. Wade.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1168,WALLACE,"Does that mean that if a liberal state, let's say, wants to make abortion legal, that you're okay with that and what do you say to conservative voters who believe deeply that abortion is murder?",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1169,PAUL,"You know, I think abortion is always wrong.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1170,PAUL,"I've supported a variety of solutions, both state as well as federal.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1171,PAUL,"In fact, just last week, I introduced the Life at Conception act, which would say that the 14th amendment would defend an individual even in the womb.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1172,PAUL,"But I think on the broader question of religion and politics, you know, I think liberty, itself requires a virtue -- requires a virtuous people.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1173,PAUL,"In fact, Washington said that democracy requires a virtuous people.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1174,PAUL,"Oz Guinness, the theologian, said that liberty requires restraint but the only restraint consistent with liberty is self-restraint.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1175,PAUL,There's a lot packed into that statement.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1176,PAUL,"But the bottom line is we must have virtue, we must have a religious bearing as a nation.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1177,PAUL,The government is not always going to save us and it's not always going to come from government.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1178,PAUL,"But if we don't know right and wrong, I think we have lost our way.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1179,PAUL,"I think we become unmoored and I think without the religious foundation that guides us all, I think we have a great risk of going horribly in the wrong direction.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1180,WALLLACE,"Sir, just 30 seconds to answer my specific...",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1181,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1182,WALLACE,Just 30 seconds to answer my specific question.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1183,WALLACE,"Do you favor the idea that abortion should be a states' rights issue and if a liberal state wants to make it legal, that that's their choice?",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1184,WALLACE,Yes or no?,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1186,PAUL,"No, both the federal and a state approach.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1187,PAUL,I have said that we could leave it to the states but I've also introduced a federal solution as well.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1188,PAUL,So the federal solution would be the Life at Conception act which is an act that would federalize the issue.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1189,PAUL,"But I've also said for the most part, these issues would be left back to the states.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1190,PAUL,So there might be an occasion if we did overturn Roe v. Wade -- Roe v. Wade nationalized the issue.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1191,PAUL,"If you had the court reverse Roe v. Wade, it would become a state issue once again.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1192,PAUL,"I think it would be better the more -- the less abortions we have, so the more states that we have that made abortion illegal, the better, as far as trying to save and preserve lives.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1200,BAIER,"Estonia, a member of NATO, essentially invokes Article V, an attack on one is an attack on all.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1201,BAIER,What do you do?,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1202,CARSON,"Look, first of all, I recognize that Vladimir Putin is an opportunist and he's a bully, and we have to face him down.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1203,CARSON,"And I would -- first of all, face him down in that whole region, the whole Baltic region.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1204,CARSON,I think we need to put in some armored brigades there.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1205,CARSON,We only have one or two.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1206,CARSON,We need much more than that.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1207,CARSON,We need to be doing military exercises if not only Estonia but Latvia and Lithuania.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1208,CARSON,They're terrified by the saber rattling.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1209,CARSON,I think we ought to put in our missile defense system.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1210,CARSON,I think we ought to give Ukraine offensive weapons and I think we ought to fight them on the economic basis because Putin is a one- horse country oil and energy.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1211,CARSON,And we ought to fight them on that level.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1212,CARSON,"We ought to be helping in terms of the technology for fracking, keeping the price low, quite frankly, because that's what's keeping him contained.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1213,CARSON,"So, yes, I'd absolutely would go in if he attacked.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1214,CARSON,"I think on Article V of NATO, we would definitely protect all of our allies.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1216,BAIER,"Gentlemen, you've all said that the Iran nuclear deal is a bad one.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1217,BAIER,"Senator Rubio, you were among the candidates who've said you would tear it up on day one.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1218,BAIER,"But as you know, Iran has already received tens of millions of dollars -- tens of billions of dollars in this deal and has quickly reestablished ties economically with Europe.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1219,BAIER,"The major concessions, in other words, are up front in this deal.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1220,BAIER,"So should you win by the time you take office, the remaining parts of the deal would be the constraints on Iran.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1221,BAIER,"So why blow up those constraints on day one, letting Iran off the hook?",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1222,RUBIO,"Well, let me first describe Iran because they're not just a normal nation state.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1223,RUBIO,And we have no quarrel with the Iranian people.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1224,RUBIO,"But the Iranian leader, their supreme leader is a radical Shia cleric who has an apocalyptic vision of the future.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1225,RUBIO,"He views himself not simply as the leader of Iran, but as the leader of all Muslims -- all Shia Muslims on the planet.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1226,RUBIO,"And they have a desire not simply to conquer the Middle East and to become the dominant power in that region, but ultimately to be able to hold America hostage.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1227,RUBIO,"That is why they're building an -- right now, developing long- range missiles capable of reaching the United States, and that is why there's going -- they're going to use those $100 billion to expand their conventional capabilities and to one day buy or build a nuclear weapon.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1228,RUBIO,"We will -- when I am president of the United States, on my first day in office, we are canceling the deal with Iran, and nations will have to make a choice.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1229,RUBIO,"They can do business with Iran, or they can do business with America, and I am very confident they're going to choose America before they choose the Iranian economy.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1230,BAIER,"Governor Kasich, you've said that Marco Rubio is wrong...",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1231,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1233,KASICH,"Look, we don't know what's going to happen in ten months.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1234,KASICH,"And if I were president of the United States right now, I'd be lining up our allies to say that, if one crossed T or one dotted I does not occur, they are -- violate the agreement, we slap back on sanctions.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1235,KASICH,"We can slap on sanctions alone, on day one, but it's not gonna be anywhere near as effective.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1236,KASICH,But the president needs to be laying the groundwork right now for the ability to slap those sanctions back on worldwide.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1237,KASICH,And I'll tell you what I'm worried about -- I'm worried about money.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1238,KASICH,"You read about all the companies now that are doing business -- about to do business in Iran, and if we don't get this settled now, with other countries in the world, about sanctions, then Iran could violate that agreement, and we're the only ones putting the sanctions on.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1239,KASICH,We need to move aggressively now.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1240,KASICH,"But I would say this to you, Bret.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1241,KASICH,"Number one, if they violate it, we need to move against them.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1242,KASICH,"And number two, if we find out they're developing a nuclear weapon and we know how to get to it, we're gonna go take it out.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1243,KASICH,That is what we have to do.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1244,KASICH,"We cannot let things get farther down the road, like we did with North Korea.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1245,BAIER,"But Governor Kasich, you know that the most powerful sanctions are the multilateral ones.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1246,KASICH,That's right.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1247,KASICH,Yes.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1248,BAIER,And these European countries are already reestablishing these ties.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1249,KASICH,"I know, Bret.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1250,BAIER,They don't want...,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1251,KASICH,"But Bret, here's the problem.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1252,KASICH,You take a look at the -- at Belgium.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1253,KASICH,I talked to a diplomat from Belgium.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1254,KASICH,"I said, ""how's it going?""",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1255,KASICH,"He said, ""we have the military in the streets right now. We never dreamt we'd ever see it.""",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1258,KASICH,We know about the French.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1260,KASICH,We know about the Brits.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1261,KASICH,"Everybody is under fire and under attack, and we have to stand together as an alliance.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1262,KASICH,"So actually, the opportunity is there, because of the threat to all of these countries, to bring all of us together...",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1263,SYSTEM,(BELL RINGS),0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1264,KASICH,... and say there is something more important than money.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1265,KASICH,It is the future of the world and the future of our children and grandchildren.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1266,KASICH,That's the kind of leadership this country needs.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1267,KASICH,It has not been in effect during the administration of Barack Obama.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1275,CHRISTIE,"Bret, let me tell you, this is another one of those places where Hillary Clinton has so much to answer for, and why she is completely unqualified to be commander in chief.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1276,CHRISTIE,"In a previous Democratic debate, Martha Raddatz, three times, asked Hillary Clinton about the failure in Libya, a policy that she took credit for, and said, ""what is your measure of responsibility, Madam Secretary, for the failure in Libya?""",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1277,CHRISTIE,"Three times, she refused to answer the question, because she refuses to be held accountable for anything that goes wrong.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1278,CHRISTIE,"If it had gone right, believe me, she would have been running around to be able to take credit for it.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1279,CHRISTIE,Here's what I'd do.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1280,CHRISTIE,"This is about the bigger, broader war against ISIS.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1282,CHRISTIE,"As president of the United States, that is exactly what I will do.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1316,BUSH,"Well first of all, I think it's important that when we're running for the highest office in the land that we recognize that we're living in dangerous times and we have to be serious about it, that our words have consequences.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1320,BUSH,"Well, that creates an environment that's toxic in our own country.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1342,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1345,CRUZ,"Well, Chris, I'm glad to discuss my views on ethanol and energy.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1346,CRUZ,"I think God has blessed this country with enormous natural resources, and we should pursue all of the above.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1347,CRUZ,"We should be developing oil, and gas, and coal, and nuclear, and wind, and solar, and ethanol, and biofuels.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1348,CRUZ,"But, I don't believe that Washington should be picking winners and losers.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1349,CRUZ,"And, I think there should be no mandates, and no subsidies whatsoever.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1350,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1351,CRUZ,"And, indeed, my tax plan that I've introduced, it's available on our website.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1352,CRUZ,It's a simple flat tax for everyone.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1353,CRUZ,"It'll produce enormous economic growth, and it eliminates every mandate, every subsidy, so there's no subsidies for oil and gas, no subsidies for anyone.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1354,CRUZ,"Now, it is true that there are a bunch of lobbyists, and a bunch of Democrats in this state spending millions of dollars trying to convince the people of Iowa that I somehow oppose ethanol.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1355,CRUZ,It's not true.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1356,CRUZ,"I have introduced legislation that would phase out the ethanol mandate over five years, but that is in the context of having no mandates whatsoever for anyone.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1357,CRUZ,"And, I would not that there's a much more important government regulation to ethanol, and that's the EPA's blend wall that makes it illegal to sell mid-level blends of ethanol in gasoline.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1359,SYSTEM,(BELL RINGING),0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1360,CRUZ,"Tear down the EPA's blend wall which will enable ethanol to expand its market share by up to 60%, all without mandates.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1361,CRUZ,All without any government mandates whatsoever through the marketplace.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1362,CRUZ,"And, I'll note finally, Chris, there is a reason that Iowa's Congressman Steve King, perhaps the fiercest defender of farmers in this state, is sharing my campaign.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1363,CRUZ,"Because he understands that I'm committed to a fair, and level playing field for every energy source without lobbyists, and without Washington picking winners and losers.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1368,CARSON,"Well, as anyone knows who's been listening to me, you know?",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1369,CARSON,"I'm very much against the government being involved in every aspect of our lives, you know?",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1370,CARSON,"We last year there was an additional 81,000 pages of government regulations.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1372,CARSON,This is absolutely absurd.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1373,CARSON,"And, they've insinuated themselves into everything.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1374,CARSON,"Now, as far as the renewable fuel standard is concerned, certain promises were made, certain government contracts were issued which extend all the way into the year 2022, and I believe that it's probably unfair to withdraw the rug because people have invested money.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1375,CARSON,People have invested a lot of energy into that.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1376,CARSON,"But, you know, we are blessed with tremendous energy in this nation, and we need to be looking for new sources of energy.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1377,CARSON,Seventy percent of our population lives bi-coastally).,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1378,CARSON,What about hydroelectric power?,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1379,CARSON,"We can develop that, you know?",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1380,CARSON,"We have so much natural gas now, and we can liquify it, and we can transfer it across the sea so we can make Europe dependent on us instead of Putin -- put him back in his little box where he belongs.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1381,CARSON,Those are the kinds of things that we ought to be doing.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1382,CARSON,"And, you know, take advantage of the tremendous opportunities in energy that God has given us, not get involved in these little petty arguments.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1383,CARSON,And we can get a lot of them out if we get the government out of our lives.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1400,PAUL,And it has been amazing to me.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1416,KASICH,Because I've seen so many things get accomplished in my lifetime.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1453,RUBIO,"And that's why Monday night, what will happen here in Iowa is so important.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv
1454,RUBIO,I'm asking you for your vote.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1455,RUBIO,"Caucus for me on Monday night because if I am your nominee, I will unite this party and I will defeat Hillary Clinton and when I'm president, America's light will shine again and the 21 century will be a new American century.",0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1463,CRUZ,We're worried the future of our children and we've have been burned over and over again.,0,20160129_7_gop.tsv

1,TAPPER,"Live from the Bank United Center on the campus of the University of Miami, this is the CNN Republican Presidential debate.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
2,TAPPER,"For our viewers in the United States and around the world, welcome to Miami Florida, I'm Jake Tapper.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
3,TAPPER,"In just five days voters will go to the polls here in this state as well as in Ohio, Illinois, North Carolina and Missouri.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
4,TAPPER,The race for the Republican nomination for president could change dramatically.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
5,TAPPER,Florida and Ohio each have a large number of delegates at stake and they award all of them to the candidate who wins.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
6,TAPPER,They're a winner-take-all state.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
7,TAPPER,So that's the first time that will happen in this primary season and this is the last debate before that critical round of voting.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
8,TAPPER,We hope tonight the candidates will give the voters specifics on their visions for America.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
9,TAPPER,So now let's welcome the candidates.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
10,TAPPER,Ohio Governor John Kasich.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
11,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
12,TAPPER,Senator Ted Cruz of Texas.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
13,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
14,TAPPER,Real estate developer and businessman Donald Trump.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
15,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
16,TAPPER,Senator Marco Rubio of Florida.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
17,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
18,TAPPER,"Ladies and gentlemen, the Republican candidates for president of the United States.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
19,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
20,TAPPER,"Before we begin this evening, we want to remember former first lady Nancy Reagan, who passed away this week.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
21,TAPPER,Her funeral will be held tomorrow and we would like to take a moment of silence to remember Nancy Reagan.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
22,SYSTEM,(MOMENT OF SILENCE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
23,TAPPER,"Now, please rise for our national anthem performed by the Frost Singers from the University of Miami.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
24,TAPPER,(STAR SPANGLED BANNER),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
25,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
26,TAPPER,Thanks to the Frost Singers from the University of Miami.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
27,TAPPER,"Candidates, you can now take your positions behind the podiums while I briefly explain the rules.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
28,TAPPER,"As moderator, I will attempt to guide the discussion, asking questions and followups.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

29,TAPPER,"Joining me in the questioning this evening will be Washington Times reporter Stephen Dinan, CNN Chief Political Correspondent Dana Bash, and Salem Radio's Hugh Hewitt.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
30,TAPPER,"Candidates, you have one minute and 15 seconds to answer each question, and 45 seconds to respond to followups or for rebuttals if your name is invoked.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
31,TAPPER,That's longer than you've had in previous debates.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
32,TAPPER,Timing lights will be visible.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
33,TAPPER,Those lights will warn you when time is up.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
34,TAPPER,"And as you requested, a bell will also sound, like this.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
35,SYSTEM,(BELL SOUND),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
36,TAPPER,"We know that each of you wants to debate these important issues, but please wait until you are called upon and please do not talk over one another.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
37,TAPPER,These are the rules to which all of you agreed.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
38,TAPPER,Our goal this evening is a serious debate on the issues.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
39,TAPPER,It's time now for opening statements.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
40,TAPPER,You'll each have 30 seconds.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
41,TAPPER,"Governor Kasich, we will start with you.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
42,KASICH,"Well, thank you.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
43,KASICH,"You know, I look in the faces of people all across this country, and I know they want to be hopeful.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
44,KASICH,And many are hopeful.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
45,KASICH,"Look, I can take conservative policies to the White House, to Washington, to restore the strength of our economy.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

46,KASICH,"But I also want to transfer power, money and influence to where you live, because I believe the strength in this country rests in the neighborhoods, the families, the communities and our states.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
47,KASICH,And I believe it's a new partnership - a partnership that can allow us to restore the spirit of America and strengthen America for the best century we've ever had.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
48,KASICH,Thank you.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
49,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
50,TAPPER,Senator Rubio?,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
51,RUBIO,Every election is important.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
52,RUBIO,I believe this is the most important election in a generation.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
53,RUBIO,Because what's at stake in this election is not simply what party is going to be in charge or which candidate wins.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
54,RUBIO,What's at stake is our identity as a nation and as a people.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
55,RUBIO,"For over two centuries, America has been an exceptional nation.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
56,RUBIO,And now the time has come for this generation to do what it must do to keep it that way.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
57,RUBIO,"If we make the right choice in this election, our children are going to be the freest and most prosperous Americans that have ever lived.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
58,RUBIO,And the 21st century is going to be a new American century.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
59,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
60,TAPPER,Senator Cruz?,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
61,CRUZ,"Fifty-nine years ago, Florida welcomed my father to America as he stepped off the ferry boat from Cuba onto Key West.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
63,CRUZ,"He was filled with hopes and dreams, and yet he was in the freest land on the face of the earth.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
64,CRUZ,"This election, this debate is not about insults.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
65,CRUZ,It's not about attacks.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
66,CRUZ,It's not about any of the individuals on this stage.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
67,CRUZ,This election is about you and your children.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

68,CRUZ,"It's about the freedom America has always had and making sure that that freedom is there for the next generation, that we stop Washington from standing in the way of the hard-working taxpayers of America.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
69,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
70,TAPPER,Mr. Trump?,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
71,TRUMP,One of the biggest political events anywhere in the world is happening right now with the Republican Party.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
72,TRUMP,Millions and millions of people are going out to the polls and they're voting.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
73,TRUMP,They're voting out of enthusiasm.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
74,TRUMP,They're voting out of love.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
75,TRUMP,"Some of these people, frankly, have never voted before - 50 years old, 60 years old, 70 years old - never voted before.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
76,TRUMP,We're taking people from the Democrat Party.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
77,TRUMP,"We're taking people as independents, and they're all coming out and the whole world is talking about it.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
78,TRUMP,It's very exciting.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
79,TRUMP,"I think, frankly, the Republican establishment, or whatever you want to call it, should embrace what's happening.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
80,TRUMP,We're having millions of extra people join.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
81,TRUMP,We are going to beat the Democrats.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
82,TRUMP,We are going to beat Hillary or whoever it may be.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
83,TRUMP,And we're going to beat them soundly.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
84,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
85,TAPPER,Thank you.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
86,TAPPER,Thank you.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
87,TAPPER,"Let's begin with jobs and the economy, which Republican voters say is the most important issue to them in this election.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
88,TAPPER,There have been some real differences expressed in - on this stage on whether trade deals have been good for the American workers.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
89,TAPPER,"One of Mr. Trump's, the front runner's, signature issues is ending what he calls ""disastrous trade deals"" in order to bring jobs back to America.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
90,TAPPER,"Governor Kasich, I'd like to start with you.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
91,TAPPER,You've been a strong advocate for these trade deals over the years.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
92,TAPPER,"Critics say these deals are great for corporate America's bottom line, but have cost the U.S. at least 1 million jobs.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
93,TAPPER,How do you respond to the criticism that you've been catering to board rooms at the expense of the American middle class?,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
94,KASICH,"Well, Jake, I grew up in a blue collar family.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
95,KASICH,And the simple fact of the matter is that of course we're sensitive about trade.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
96,KASICH,One out of five Americans works in a job connected to trade; 38 million Americans are connected to it.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
97,KASICH,"But my position has always been we want to have free trade, but fair trade.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

98,KASICH,"And I've been arguing all along that it is absolutely critical that when other countries break those agreements, we don't turn the process over to some international bureaucrat who comes back a couple years later and says, ""Oh, America was right,"" and people are out of work.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
99,KASICH,The fact of the matter is we have to have an expedited process.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
100,KASICH,"When people cheat, when countries cheat and they take advantage of us, we need to blow the whistle.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
101,KASICH,"And as president of the United States, I absolutely will blow the whistle and begin to stand up for the American worker.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
102,KASICH,But we don't want to lock the doors and pull down the blinds and leave the world.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
103,KASICH,"Because frankly, if we do that, prices will go up.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
104,KASICH,People will buy less.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
105,KASICH,Other people will be out of work.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
106,KASICH,And we don't want to see that happen.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

107,KASICH,"Trade, though, has to be balanced and we have to make sure that when we see a violation, like some country dumping their products into this country, believe me as president, I will stand up and I will shut down those imports because they're a violation of the agreement we have and the American worker expects us to stand up.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
108,KASICH,"And Jake, my family worked in the steel industry, not with a white collar.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
109,KASICH,I understand their plight.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
110,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

111,TAPPER,"Mr. Trump, your critics say your campaign platform is inconsistent with how you run your businesses, noting that you've brought in foreign workers instead of hiring Americans, and your companies manufacture clothing in China and Mexico.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
112,TAPPER,Why should voters trust that you will run the country differently from how you run your businesses?,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
113,TRUMP,Because nobody knows the system better than me.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
114,TRUMP,I know the H1B.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
115,TRUMP,I know the H2B.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
116,TRUMP,Nobody knows it better than me.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
117,TRUMP,I'm a businessman.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
118,TRUMP,These are laws.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
119,TRUMP,These are regulations.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
120,TRUMP,These are rules.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
121,TRUMP,We're allowed to do it.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

122,TRUMP,"And frankly, because of the devaluations that other countries - the monetary devaluations that other countries are constantly doing and brilliantly doing against us, it's very, very hard for our companies in this country, in our country, to compete.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
123,TRUMP,So I will take advantage of it; they're the laws.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
124,TRUMP,But I'm the one that knows how to change it.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
125,TRUMP,"Nobody else on this dais knows how to change it like I do, believe me.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
126,TAPPER,"Senator Rubio, last October, you said that you're, quote, ""generally very much in favor of free trade.""",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
127,TAPPER,"More recently, you backed a away from your support of some trade deals.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
128,TAPPER,"If elected, will you support free trade deals even if it means the inevitable loss of U.S. jobs?",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
129,RUBIO,"No, I support free trade deals that are good for America.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
130,RUBIO,We're 5 percent of the world's population.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
131,RUBIO,"If all we do is sell things to each other, we can only sell to 5 percent of the people on earth.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
132,RUBIO,We have to have access to the hundreds of millions of people in the world today who can afford to buy things.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
133,RUBIO,The problem is we're a low-tariff country.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
134,RUBIO,"To import something into the United States is not very expensive, but many of these countries we can't export to because their tariffs are too high.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
135,RUBIO,And so I am in favor of deals that allow us to bring down those tariffs so that America can sell things to all these people around the world.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
136,RUBIO,There are good trade deals and there are bad ones.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
137,RUBIO,"So for example, here in Florida, we have benefited from the free trade deal with Colombia.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

138,RUBIO,It's allowed flower exporters to come into the United States but it's created jobs for hundreds of people who are now delivering those flowers and working in that industry.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
139,RUBIO,We have a surplus with Colombia.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
140,RUBIO,"On the other hand, you've seen trade deals like in Mexico that have been less than promising in some aspects, better in others.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

141,RUBIO,"Bottom line is I believe that America, if given access to foreign markets, our workers are the most productive in the world, our people are the most innovative on this planet.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
142,RUBIO,"If it is a free and fair trade deal, we can compete against anyone in the world, and we need to in the 21st century.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
143,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
144,TAPPER,"Senator Cruz, you were a supporter of the Pacific trade deal, but after taking some heat from conservatives, you changed your position.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
145,TAPPER,Why should these voters who don't like these trade deals trust that you will fight for them all the time and not just in election years?,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
146,CRUZ,Actually that's incorrect.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
147,CRUZ,There are two different agreements.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
148,CRUZ,There's TPA and TPP.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
149,CRUZ,"I opposed TPP and have always opposed TPP, which is what you asked about.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
150,CRUZ,"And when it comes to trade, look, free trade, when we open up foreign markets, helps Americans.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
151,CRUZ,But we're getting killed in international trade right now.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
152,CRUZ,And we're getting killed because we have an administration that's doesn't look out for American workers and jobs are going overseas.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
153,CRUZ,We're driving jobs overseas.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
154,CRUZ,"And the people who are losing out are in manufacturing jobs, or the steel industry or the auto industry.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
155,CRUZ,"But I'll tell you who else is going to be losing out, which is the service industry.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
156,CRUZ,This Obama administration is negotiating the Trade in Services Agreement which is another treaty to allow services to come in and take jobs from Americans as well.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
157,CRUZ,And you've got to understand.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
158,CRUZ,"Trade and immigration are interwoven, and they are hurting the working men and women of this country.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
159,CRUZ,"So the question is, what's the solution?",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
160,CRUZ,It's easy to talk about the problems.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
161,CRUZ,But do you have a solution to fix it?,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
162,CRUZ,And I think the solution is several things.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
163,CRUZ,"Number one, we need to negotiate trade deals protecting American workers first, not the corporate board room.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

170,DINAN,"Senator Rubio in late 2014, Disney laid off 250 tech workers in Orlando, replacing many of them with foreign workers.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
171,DINAN,Some of the Americans even had to train their own replacements.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
172,DINAN,You support increasing the H-1B visa program that made it possible to bring in these foreign workers.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
173,DINAN,Doesn't this program take jobs away from Americans?,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
174,RUBIO,If it's being abused the way Disney did.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
175,RUBIO,"Understand that program, it is illegal now under that program to use it to replace American workers.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
176,RUBIO,"Under that program, you have to prove not only that you're not replacing Americans, but that you've tried to hire Americans.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
177,RUBIO,"And if a company is caught abusing that process, they should never be allowed to use it again.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

179,RUBIO,"They are hiring a consulting company like Tata, for example, out of India.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
180,RUBIO,That company then hoards up all of these visas.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
181,RUBIO,They hire workers.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
182,RUBIO,You hire - Disney or some other company hires this company.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
183,RUBIO,What they're basically doing is they are insourcing and outsourcing.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
184,RUBIO,"They are bringing in workers from abroad that are not direct employees of a Disney or someone else, they're employees of this consulting business.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

185,RUBIO,"And what I argue is that no consulting business such as that should be allowed to hoard up all of these visas, that the visas should only be available for companies to use to directly hire workers and that we should be stricter in how he enforce it.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
186,RUBIO,"It is illegal now, it is a violation of the law now to use that program to replace Americans.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
187,RUBIO,"And if a company is caught doing that, whether it be Disney or anyone else, they should be barred from using the program in the future.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

189,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

195,RUBIO,What they are doing is they are in fact using that program to replace an American.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
196,RUBIO,"If there's an American working at Disney and they bring someone from another country using H1B to replace their direct job, that's in violation of the law.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

202,RUBIO,It's a loophole they've figured out that we need to close so they can no longer continue to do it that way.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

216,KASICH,"So, we - I have a comprehensive plan to deal with this problem of immigration.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

218,KASICH,"And if anybody were to come in after that, they are going to have to go back.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

220,KASICH,"I think we ought to have a guest worker program, where people come in, work and go home.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

221,KASICH,"And I think at the same time, for the 11 and a half million who are here, then in my view if they have not committed a crime since they've been here, they get a path to legalization.",0,20160311_12_gop.tsv

237,TRUMP,And we should end it.,0,20160311_12_gop.tsv
